INFESTED, ROTTEN CORPSE IMAGINABLE JUMPS UP
DISK TO ANOTHER UNTIL THE WHOLE CHAMBER IS LIT UP. LIGHT
PUNCHES UP OUT OF THE SAND, ACCOMPANIED BY THE MOST HORRI
HITS THE DISK AND QUICKLY SHOOTS AROUND THE ROOM FROM ONE
FROM ONE DISK TO ANOTHER UNTIL THE WHOLE CHAMBER IS LIT U
EVERYTHING HAPPENS AT ONCE, READ FASTER
AN INTENSE BURST OF ACID SPRAYS OUT OF THE SEAM AND HITS
-- AN INTENSE BURST OF LIQUID SPRAYS OUT OF THE SEAM. HIT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glaring out over the city at the setting sun is a handsom muscular MAN with intense, evil eyes. This is IMHOTEP.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Home of Imhotep, High Priest of  Osiris, Keeper of the Dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A gorgeous, olive-skinned goddess enters the outer foyer. takes us a moment to realize that the skin-tight dress sh wearing isn't a dress at all, but rather her entire naked body has been PAINTED in the ancient Egyptian manner She' stunning sight to behold. This is ANCK-SU-NAMUN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Birthplace of Anck-su-namun. Pharaoh's  Mistress. No other man was allowed  to touch her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She makes her way through the ornate statuary. The CAMERA comes to a stop on a CRACKED STONE FACE. A BEAT. And then it's eyes suddenly POP OPEN. It's really a strange lookin TATTOOED MAN. Several more of these hideous, bald MEN sta nearby. They are the PRIESTS of Osiris. Imhotep's guys. T eyes watch Anck-su-namun vanish through the bedroom curta Anck-su-namun embraces Imhotep, they kiss passionately,  feverishly. Imhotep's hands roam over her perfect body,  smearing the paint. The Narrator's VOICE fills with lust:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But for our love, we were willing to  risk life itself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And we realize that the Narrator is actually Imhotep hims on the other-side of the curtains, the bald Priests rush  over and close the doors. But just as they do, the doors  suddenly BURST OPEN. Pharaoh angrily strides in, looks at the Priests. The following DIALOGUE is in ANCIENT EGYPTIA SUBTITLED.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Priests back away, scared shitless, obviously his arr was unexpected. Pharaoh strides for the curtains. Throws  them back. Anck-su-namun stands alone. Gives him a sexy smile. Phara sees the smeared body paint. Points his finger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHO HAS TOUCHED YOU?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From behind him, his sword is ripped out of its scabbard. Pharaoh spins around. It's Imhotep. Pharaoh is shocked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Imhotep?... My priest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behind him, Anck-su-namun lifts a dagger and plunges it i his back. Pharaoh SCREAMS. Imhotep raises Pharaoh's sword. The hide bald Priests SLAM the doors and bolt them tight. Through curtains, they see the SHADOWS of Anck-su-namun and Imhot stab away at Pharaoh. Suddenly, the doors are RAMMED from the other side, --WHAM! Imhotep and Anck-su-namun turn an look. --WHAM! The doors are RAMMED again. The two lovers  share desperate looks. --WHAM! The bald Priests run up an grab Imhotep and try and pull him towards the balcony.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pharaoh's bodyguards!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Imhotep tries to break free, but Anck-su-namun rips Phara sword out of his hand and pushes him towards the balcony.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You must go. Save yourself. Only you  can resurrect me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Imhotep's face fills with despair. The DOORS EXPLODE OPEN MEN with BLUE-TINTED SKIN and strange PUZZLE-TATTOOS over their bodies stride in, armed to the teeth. These are the MUMIA. The Priests hustle Imhotep out onto the dark balco just as the Mumia rip through the curtains. Anck-su-namun points at Pharaoh and hisses --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My body is no longer his temple!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She PLUNGES the sword into her own heart. Out on the balc Imhotep's mouth opens into a horrible silent scream...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For murdering Pharaoh, Anck-su-namun's  body was to be cursed. And it was I,  the High Priest, whose duty it was  to curse it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Imhotep leads-a TORCH-LIT procession across the dunes. An su-namun's mummy is carried by NUBIAN SLAVES. They put he down in the sand along with FIVE JEWEL ENCRUSTED JARS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her body was mummified, her vital  organs removed and placed in sacred  canopic jars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Imhotep, filled with dread, reads from a OBOOKO made out pure GOLD. THIS IS THE BOOK OF THE LIVING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Book of The Living contained  sacred incantations that would send  the evil dead on a journey into the  dark underworld.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Strange LIGHT suddenly FLASHES across the faces of the sl and the EGYPTIAN SOLDIERS. Suddenly, everyone's fear-fill eyes all rise, as if watching Anck-su-namun's body rising Then one last HUGE FLASH, accompanied by a BLAST OF WIND, and it's over. Anck-su-namun's body now lies twisted on t ground. Imhotep's Priests place the body into a stone sarcophagus The Nubian slaves lower it into a hole and bury it with s Imhotep then signals to the Soldiers, who throw their spe at the Nubians. Killing them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The slaves were killed...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Imhotep's knife-wielding Priests attack the now unarmed  Soldiers, hacking at them in the flickering darkness as  Imhotep and the Mumia solemnly watches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and the soldiers who killed them  were also slain, so that no unholy  person should ever know the exact  location of the burial site.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Mumia walk off across the sand and then, one by one, Priests stop their frenzied stabbing and stare off at the vanishing Mumia. As the last Mumia disappears over a dist dune, Imhotep nods, and the Priests leap onto Anck-su-nam grave and begin digging it back up with their hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHARIOTS race out into the moonlit desert. Imhotep leads way. A "hearse" carries Anck-su-namun's mummy. THE MAP OF ANCIENT EGYPT FADES UP. The chariots race across the map.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But there was another book, The Book  Of The Dead, which was never to be  opened, never to be read, for it  contained the incantations that could  bring a dead body back to life a  most unholy thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The chariots arrive at a place marked on the map in hiera They race up the stone ramp and in through the city gates SUPERIMPOSED across the SCREEN are the WORDS: HAMUNAPTRA - City of the Dead

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was hidden at Hamunaptra, City of  the Dead, inside the statue of Anubis,  so that no such sacrilege might ever  disgrace Egypt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Imhotep pulls an ORNATE CHEST out of a SECRET COMPARTMENT inside the giant STATUE OF ANUBIS. He opens the chest and lifts out THE BOOK OF THE DEAD, made of black stone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But for my love of Anck-su-namun I  was willing to defy the gods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Big hairy RATS scurry through the mausoleums and over the headstones of this very large, scary, UNDERGROUND CEMETER A DETRITUS MOAT surrounds the cemetery, -- muck made out filthy water and human remains. Skulls bob in the goop. T Priests have gathered in a circle. Their hooded, lifeless eyes seem dead to this world. Their bald heads rock back forth as they CHANT, a quiet eerie HUM. Heinous creatures In the middle of the circle is a strange, twisted ALTAR. Imhotep has unwrapped Anck-su-namun's gorgeous, lifeless  body and placed her five sacred canopic jars around her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anck-su-namun's vital organs were  still fresh, so a human sacrifice  would not need be made.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Imhotep begins to read from The Book of The Dead, a la SWIRLING HOLE starts to open in the detritus bog. Several Priests look over at it, frightened, then quickly look ba down and resume CHANTING. A strange MIST wafts up out of swirling hole and over to the jars, it passes through the and into Anck-su-namun's body. One of the jars SHUDDERS, heart inside begins to BEAT. The CHANTING PRIESTS, SWIRLI HOLE, WAFTING MIST, BEATING HEART and IMHOTEP'S READINGS reaching a crescendo. Anck-su-namun's EYES suddenly FLY O

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anck-su-namun soul had come back  from the dead! Now all that was  needed, was to return her organs to  their rightful place within her body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Imhotep lifts a sacrificial knife above Anck-su-namun's  breast, about to plunge it down. The CHANTING, SWIRLING a BEATING heart CLIMAX. And that's when the Mumia BURST IN storm through the startled Priests. The HEAD MUMIA SMASHE the jar with the beating heart. The MIST instantly sucks  back out of Anck-su-namun's body and IMPLODES back into t swirling hole. Anck-su-namun's eyes close. Dying once again. Imhotep SCR in rage. The Mumia grab him and his Priests.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My Priests were condemned to be  mummified alive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inside a TORCH-LIT CHAMBER, Imhotep is held by Anubis-hea EMBALMERS. He cringes at the flickering, impressionistic  glimpses of his Priests being embalmed and mummified aliv The horrid-looking Embalmers, using knives, needles and  thread, calmly perform their ghastly surgery on the SCREA Priests, who are going insane from the procedure. A red hot POKER is pulled out of a pit of burning coals. A Priest's head is wedged between two strong boards. His  eyes widen in terror as an Embalmer moves to insert the r hot poker up his nose. But just before he does, WE QUICKLY CUT TO IMHOTEP'S FACE horrified, as OFF CAMERA, the Priest SCREAMS. WE GO WIDE on the chamber. All twenty-one of Imhotep's Pr squirm inside their wrappings. Imhotep is forced to his k His arms are held back. His mouth is pried open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As for me, I was condemned to endure  the HOM-DAI. The worst of all ancient  curses. One so horrible, it had never  before been bestowed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Using a pair of tongs, an Embalmer slowly pulls Imhotep's TONGUE out of his mouth, then places a very sharp knife o top of it. WE GO TIGHT on IMHOTEP'S EYES as his tongue is apparently cut out. The Embalmer flings Imhotep's tongue  onto the floor. The Mumia's dogs attack and quickly eat i Imhotep is WRAPPED ALIVE. Only his mouth, nostrils and  fearfilled eyes are left free of the slimy bandages. Detr muck boils inside a black cauldron. Embalmers scoop out t fetid muck and apply it to Imhotep's wrappings as he squi He's then laid in a wooden COFFIN inside a stone SARCOPHA An Embalmer with a BUCKET steps up and looks into the cof Imhotep's wild eyes stare back. The Embalmer empties the  bucket over Imhotep's chest: dozens of SCARABS, disgustin dung beetles. They scurry across Imhotep's SCREAMING face Some vanish into his tongue-less mouth and up his nostril

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By eating the sacred scarabs, I would  be cursed to stay alive forever. And  by eating me, they were cursed just  the same.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lid to the coffin is SLAMMED SHUT. Then, using a stra four-sided KEY, the Head Mumia locks the coffin lid tight The heavy sarcophagus lid is shoved into place and with a loud WHOOSH seals itself airtight. Once again, the Head M uses the strange key, locking the sarcophagus lid tight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was to remain sealed inside my  sarcophagus, the undead for all of  eternity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The blue-skinned, strangely tattooed man carefully collap the sides of the key, -- turning it into a little puzzle  BOX.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They would never allow me to be  released. For I would arise a walking  disease, a plague upon mankind, an  unholy flesh-eater, with the strength  of ages, power over the sands, and  the glory of invincibility.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Imhotep's sarcophagus is dropped into a DETRITUS PIT. The disgusting muck SPLASHES up, drools down it-s sides, and  then is mysteriously sucked into It's seams, vanishing cl

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And if I could raise my beloved Anck- su-namun from her place in hell,  together, we would be an unstoppable  infection upon this world. The  Apocalypse. The End.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Imhotep's horrifying tongue-less SCREAMS can be heard com from inside his sarcophagus as grave diggers shovel dirt  onto it. THE MAIN TITLE IS SUPERIMPOSED ON THE SCREAM:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The heavily armed Mumia stand guard around Imhotep's grav Looking down on the burial site is the huge statue of ANU the jackal-headed god of death. It stares at us. Then beg to DECAY before our very eyes, aging 4,159 years in only  seconds. And then we find ourselves and the decrepit, hal buried statue of Anubis out in the middle of the desert.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Imhotep's horrifying SCREAMS become the SCREAMS of a TUAR HORSEMAN. Racing across the desert with two thousand of his warrior brethren. Armed to the teeth. SUPERIMPOSED across the SCR are the WORDS:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A mile across the scorching desert TWO HUNDRED FRENCH FOR LEGIONNAIRES scurry through the ruins, preparing for the  onslaught. OUR HERO is up on the wall. His Kepi sits at a jaunty angle. Dashing and handsome. This is RICK O'CONNEL He looks out at the massive SCREAMING horde galloping at  him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I knew this was gonna be a lousy  day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A doughy little Frenchman joins him as he makes his way a the top of the wall. This is BENI.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Personally, I would like to surrender.  Why can we not just surrender?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut-up and gimme your bandolier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beni pulls off his cartridge belt. Hands it to O'Connell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then let's run away. Right now. While  we can still make it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Connell throws it on, crisscrossing his own bandolier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now gimme your revolver, you'll never  use it anyway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beni pulls out his pistol and chucks it to O'Connell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then let's play dead, huh? Nobody  ever does that anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Connell slides it into his belt, next to his own revolv

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now go find me a big stick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the desert? What for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Connell turns and goes nose-to-nose with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So I can tie it to your back, you  appear to be without a spine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The horde of warriors THUNDERS forward. Now a half mile o Scimitars RATTLING. O'Connell and Beni run through the ru

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd a guy like you end up in the  Legion anyways?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got caught robbing a synagogue.  Lots of good stuff in them holy  places; churches, temples, mosques,  and who's guarding them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Altar boys?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactly! I speak seven languages,  including Hebrew, so my specialty  was synagogues. How about you? Kill  somebody?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beni trips and accidentally tackles O'Connell to the grou O'Connell gives him a nasty look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, but I'm considering it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They get up and run out the gate and down the stone ramp

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What then? Robbery? Extortion?  Kidnapping!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: None of the above, thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then what the hell are you doing  here!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They both skid to a stop at the front line as they see th horde of warriors. The SOUND of CHARGING HORSES is deafen O'Connell gives Beni a big cheesy smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was just looking for a good time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And that's when the cowardly Legionnaire Colonel suddenly panics, cuts and runs. O'Connell instantly stiffens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh shit. Steady!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gives the men around him courage. But onward comes the ho Hoofs pounding the sand. Several more Legionnaires take o

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STEADY! (to himself) What the hell am I sayin'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Tuaregs let loose with those horrifying oooo-loo-loog SCREAMS. More Legionnaires haul-ass. Beni is one of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STEADY!! (to himself) What the hell am I doin'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Tuaregs set their rifles and take aim. O'Connell stee himself, cocks and locks. The cartridge in his mouth sudd snaps, he spits it into the sand. Another BEAT. And then

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FIRE!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Legionnaires on the ground FIRE. The rifles report wi a CRASH. The BLAST blows dozens of Tuaregs clean off thei mounts. The prone Legionnaires quickly begin to reload.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FIRE!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The kneeling Legionnaires FIRE. More Tuaregs bite the san The remaining warriors OPEN FIRE. THUNDER and SMOKE rip t hot air. A third of the Legionnaires are killed instantly

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FIRE!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The remaining standing Legionnaires FIRE. Tuaregs spin of their mounts. Crash to the sand. And then the entire Tuar force plows into the ruins and through the Legionnaires. O'Connell grabs the barrel of his rifle and starts CLUBBI riders off their steeds, fighting like a man possessed. Beni on the other hand, is bellycrawling across the sand, whimpering in full retreat as Legionnaires fall dead all  around him. He crawls through the front gate. O'Connell throws his rifle down and goes for his guns. He cross-draws, gun in each hand, starts blowing riders off  their mounts. Beni crawls faster, and then he spots an open TEMPLE DOOR amongst the rocks. He gets up and sprints for the door as the last of the Legionnaires are shot off their feet behi him. O'Connell's guns go empty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Son-of-a-bitch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns and runs like hell, right through the front gate Four Tuareg warriors on massive Arabians haul-ass after h O'Connell hurdles a stone column, hits the ground running He spots Beni inside the Temple doorway, trying to close heavy sandstone door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! Beni! Wait up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beni has no intention of waiting up, he pushes harder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are ya doing?! Wait up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Connell runs faster. Beni pushes harder. The four Horse LEAP the big column and CHARGE after him. HOOFS POUNDING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you close that door! DON'T YOU  CLOSE THAT DOOR!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beni closes the door just as O'Connell reaches it. O'Conn SLAMS his body into the door. It doesn't budge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna get you for this!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns and bolts off around the rocks. Running for his  life, weaving through the ruins. The Arabians getting clo and closer. The POUNDING hoofs getting LOUDER and LOUDER. O'Connell finally spins around and faces his attackers. T four massive horses crash to a stop in front of him. The  vicious Tuaregs raise their rifles to finish him off. O'Connell just stands there, exhausted and beaten, then h slowly lifts his right hand and gives them the bird. And that's when the horses go ape-shit. All four of them  REAR UP. Two of the Riders are THROWN to the ground. The  horses SCREECH and BELLOW and SNORT in fear, then buck li fury and haul-ass away as if the devil himself had scared them. The thrown Riders get up and race off after their  mounts. O'Connell just stands there, stunned, then he lifts his r hand and checks out his middle finger. And then he feels evil himself, and turns around. -- The shattered, decrepi statue of Anubis stares back at him. Suddenly, the sand begins to shift under O'Connell's feet He starts to back away, keeping his eyes on the transform sand, it looks like huge snakes are wiggling and writhing beneath it, forming lines and shapes, -- drawing a pictur O'Connell quickly turns and runs off through the ruins. T sand stops moving, and we can now see that, drawn in the  sand, is a picture of IMHOTEP'S SCREAMING FACE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Up on a ridge, A GROUP OF RIDERS watch O'Connell stumble  clear of the decrepit city. O'Connell feels their presenc and looks up. Very different from the Tuaregs, they have  BLUE TINTED SKIN and faces covered in strange PUZZLE-TATT The Mumia. Still watching Imhotep's grave after all this  time. The MUMIA LEADER is a huge, fierce Man in black robes, wi dual scimitars across his waist. His face is both handsom and horrible, blue and tattooed. Meet ARDETH RAY. His dar eyes watch O'Connell stagger off into the open desert...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cairo, a city so old the stars have actually changed thei positions in the sky since it's birth. A city teeming wit every form of life. A strange, mysterious, wonderful city WE SUPERIMPOSE it's name across the SCREEN:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deep in the bowels of the museum lie the STACKS. Rows upo rows of towering bookshelves. Filled with literature on t Antiquities. Standing at the top of a tall ladder between two of these rows and leaning against one of the bookshel is a rather uninteresting British GIRL: eye-glasses, hair a-bun, long boring dress, your typical prudish nightmare. This is EVELYN CARNARVON. We're going to fall in love wit her. Evelyn pulls a book out from a stack under her arm, blows the dust off it, then places it on a shelf with other boo whose titles all begin with the letter "O". Then she grab another book out from under her arm and reads the title.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tuthmosis?... Now how did you get up  here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carefully, so as not to lose her balance, she looks over shoulder to the bookshelf behind her, where all the title begin with the letter "T". Then she looks down. It's a lo way to the bottom. Evelyn gently sets the other books dow on the top shelf, then turns and gingerly starts to reach across the aisle with the Tuthmosis book. It's a little t far, so she stretches, reaching, holding the top of the l with her fingertips, she's almost got it, closer now clos And that's when the ladder pulls away from the shelf. Eve YELPS, flings the Tuthmosis book and grabs the top of the ladder, which stands straight up. Evelyn holds her breath swaying precariously, a long BEAT, and then she loses her balance, the ladder swings around and Evelyn starts  stiltwalking down the aisle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OHEIUGM!! AHHHHHH!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ladder crosses the aisle, does an about face and head back the way it came. Evelyn clings to the top, strugglin for balance. The ladder teeters out into the main aisle a picks up speed. Evelyn SCREAMS as it does a 180, spins in another aisle and finally crashes to a stop at the top of bookshelf. Evelyn holds her breath, then SIGHS HEAVILY. And that's when the bookshelf falls away from her and CRA into the next bookshelf. Evelyn slides down the ladder and plops to the floor. She looks up just as the domino effect kicks-in: each bookshe crashing into the next. And onward it goes. Bookshelf aft bookshelf. Thousands of volumes flinging off shelves and  scattering across the floor. It finally ends as the last  shelf CRASHES into a wall. Evelyn's eyes are closed. She  opens one eye. Looks left. Then right. Then opens the oth eye and stares at the huge mess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Egyptian CURATOR storms in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at this! Sons of the Messiah!  Give me frogs, flies, locusts,  anything but this! Compared to you,  the other plagues were a joy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evelyn quickly gets up and starts gathering books.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, it was an accident.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When Ramesses destroyed Syria, it  was an accident. You are a  catastrophe! Why do I put up with  you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evelyn turns to him, trying to contain herself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You put up with me, because I can  read and write ancient Egyptian,  decipher hieroglyphs and hieratic,  and I'm the only person within a  thousand miles who knows how to  properly code and catalogue this  library.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who needs smart women? I put up with  you because your mother and father  were our finest patrons, Allah rest  their souls. Now straighten up this  mess!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Curator storms out. Evelyn just stands there, steamin And then she hears a NOISE and quickly turns around. A BE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quiet. Eerie. And then she hears it again, like feet, slo shuffling across the floor, coming from a nearby gallery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abdul? Mohammed? Bob?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evelyn walks through the stacks and enters --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Filled with treasures and plunder from the Middle Kingdom It's very dark and quiet in here, the only LIGHT is from  FLICKERING TORCHES at either end of the spooky gallery. The NOISE again! From the far side of the room. Feet, slo shuffling, plodding across the floor. Evelyn grabs a torc Looks around, at a statue of Anubis, another of Horus, th stare down at Evelyn, who is starting to get scared now. walks down the aisle. Past a closed sarcophagus. Past cas of ancient artifacts. Past another sarcophagus, -- only t one is OPEN! Evelyn freezes, swallows hard, nervously loo around to see who could have opened it. Then she slowly l forward with the torch, and peers inside. -- A hideous rotted MUMMY sits up and SCREECHES at her! Evelyn SCREAMS, drops the torch and backs away, scared ou of her wits. And then, coming from inside the sarcophagus she hears a Man LAUGHING. Her eyes narrow as a foppish ca crawls out from behind the Mummy, laughing his ass off, h drunk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You...! YOU...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drunkard? Fool? Rat-bastard? Please  call me something original.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meet JONATHAN CARNARVON. As he crawls out of the sarcopha Evelyn pulls a cigarette out of the mummy's mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you no respect for the dead?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right now, I only wish to join them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He grins drunkenly. Evelyn punches him hard in the chest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well I wish you'd do it sooner rather  than later, before you ruin my career  the way you've ruined yours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My dear, sweet, baby sister, I'll  have you know, that at this moment  my career is on a high note.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He BELCHES, then falls back and sits on the edge of a tom

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: High note? Ha! For five years you've  been scrounging around Egypt, and  what have you to show for it? Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jonathan excitedly starts scrounging around in his jacket

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yes I do! I have something right  here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh no, not another worthless trinket,  Jonathan, if I bring one more piece  of junk to the Curator to try and  sell for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jonathan pulls out a small, ancient BOX; the collapsed KE to Imhotep's sarcophagus and coffin. Evelyn is instantly  curious, she grabs the box out of his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where did you get this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jonathan knows her weaknesses, gives her a mischievous sm

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On a dig, down in Thebes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evelyn rolls the box around in her hands, mumbling to her as she translates the hieratics and hieroglyphs covering Jonathan licks his lips in anticipation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My whole life I've never found  anything, Evy. Tell me I've found  something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evelyn's fingers play with the various little slats on th box, shifting them this way and that way, it's like a puz box. Then suddenly, it UNFOLDS ITSELF, almost-mechanicall turning itself into the KEY. Sitting inside the open key/ is a folded piece of GOLDEN PAPYRUS. An ANCIENT MAP.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jonathan?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think you found something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Curator sits at his desk, staring through a jeweler's eyepiece at the key/box. Evelyn hovers behind him, excite

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See the cartouche there, it's the  official royal seal of Seti the First,  I'm sure of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perhaps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jonathan leans in from across the desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two questions. Who the hell is Seti  the First? And was he rich?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was the last Pharaoh of the Old  Kingdom, said to be the wealthiest  Pharaoh of them all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, good, that's good. I like  this fellow, like him very much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Curator picks up the MAP. It's actually the exact sam map that we established in the opening scenes of the movi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've already dated it, this map is  almost four thousand years old. And  the hieratics over here... (Inhales deeply) It's Hamunaptra.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Curator freezes, suddenly very nervous, then he recov

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My dear girl, don't be ridiculous,  we are scholars, not treasure hunters.  Hamunaptra is a myth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are we talking about the Hamunaptra?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. The City of The Dead. Where the  early Pharaohs were said to have  hidden the wealth of Egypt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right, right, in a big underground  treasure chamber. Everybody knows  the story. The entire necropolis was  rigged to sink into the sand. On  Pharaoh's command, a flick of the  switch! And the whole place could  disappear beneath the dunes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All we know is that the city  mysteriously vanished around 2,134  B.C.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Curator holds the map closer to the burning CANDLE-LA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the Americans would say: it's all  fairy tales and hokum.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The map 'accidentally,' CATCHES ON FIRE. The Curator thro it to the floor. Jonathan drops to his knees and quickly  puts it out. Lifts it up. The left third of the map is no missing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You burned it! You burned off the  part with the lost city!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's for the best, I'm sure. Many  men have wasted their lives in the  foolish pursuit of Hamunaptra, no  one has ever found it, most have  never returned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (devastated) You killed my map.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sure it was a fake, anyway, I'm  surprised at you, Miss Carnarvon, to  be so fooled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Curator reaches for the key/box. Evelyn quickly snatc it off the desk and gives him a very angry, suspicious lo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cairo prison. One of the worst hell holes on earth. Every low-life form of scumbag can be found here. The WARDEN, a first rate scumbag himself, escorts Evelyn and Jonathan a the gallows courtyard. Evelyn whispers to Jonathan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You told me you found it on a dig  down in Thebes!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was mistaken.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You lied to me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I lie to everybody, what makes you  so special?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm your sister.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That just makes you more gullible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You stole it from a drunk at the  local Casbah?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Picked his pocket, actually.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Warden ushers Evelyn and Jonathan into the holding pe

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what is he in prison for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did not know, so when I heard you  were coming, I asked him that myself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what did he say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He said... he was just looking for a  good time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The interior cell door BURSTS OPEN. O'Connell is in chain dragged by FOUR GUARDS, they shove him up to the cell bar From the looks of it, he's been here awhile; his face is  half hidden by long hair, a scraggly beard and many new  bruises. Evelyn looks at him, disgusted by his appearance

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But he's just a filthy criminal?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cringing) Way to go, Evy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Connell gives Evelyn the once over, then looks at Jonat

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So who's the broad?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Broad?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's my sister, actually.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah? Well,... I'm sure she's not a  total loss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evelyn is stunned and furious. The Warden heads out the d

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be back in a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sarcastic) I tremble with anticipation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Guard CLUBS O'Connell across the head, O'Connell's face bounces off the metal bars. He shows no pain, but just lo back and gives the Guard a nasty look. Evelyn steps close

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We uh,... found... your puzzle box,  and we've come to ask you about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No... You came to ask me about  Hamunaptra.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evelyn and Jonathan quickly look around, hoping the guard didn't hear him. They step closer. Evelyn plays coy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you know the box pertains to  Hamunaptra?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because that's where I found it. I  was there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evelyn is dumbstruck. But Jonathan looks suspicious

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do we know that's not a load of  pig swallow?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Connell looks closer at Jonathan, a glint of recognitio

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey,... don't I know you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um, well, you see...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Connell's FIST comes flying through the bars, hits Jona square in the jaw, DECKS HIM. He hits the floor. Out cold Guard CLUBS O'Connell. His head bounces off the bars agai He shows no pain, but gives the Guard another nasty look. Evelyn looks down at her brother, then back at O'Connell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were actually at Hamunaptra?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just decked your brother

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, well... (shrugs) I know my brother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Connell almost smiles. There's a bit of spark to this g

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I was there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You swear?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Every damn day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I mean --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- I know what you mean. I was there,  alright. Seti's place. The City Of  The Dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you find? What did you see?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I found sand. I saw death.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The warden enters. Evelyn quickly leans closer to O'Conne

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could you tell me how to get there?  The exact location?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Want to know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evelyn leans in even closer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really want to know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She leans her face right up to the bars, nervous and exci

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Connell steps forward and KISSES her full on the lips.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then get me the hell outta here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evelyn is stunned. A Guard CLUBS him, his face bounces of the bars again, but before he can react the Guards GRAB h YANKS him away from the bars and DRAG him out of the room

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are they taking him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To be hanged.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evelyn is shocked. The warden shows-off his green teeth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Apparently, he had a very good time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hundreds of filthy PRISONERS stare down onto the gallows the hangman's noose is draped over O'Connell's head and  cinched tight around his neck. Evelyn follows the warden  onto a balcony above the gallows. The prisoners all go de quiet at the sight of her; like jackals staring at fresh  meat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No women allowed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am an English woman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This seems to confuse the Warden, he shrugs and sits down O'Connell looks up as Evelyn plops down beside the Warden

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will give you one hundred pounds  to spare his life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I would pay one hundred pounds just  to see him hang.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two hundred pounds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Proceed!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three hundred pounds!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Connell can hear every word, he looks hopeful. Other th Evelyn, you could hear a pin drop. The HANGMAN turns to h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any last requests, pig?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I'd like ya to let me go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Hangman grabs the lever to the trapdoor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FIVE HUNDRED POUNDS!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Warden sets his greasy, lecherous hand on Evelyn's le

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what else?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evelyn is revolted, she quickly shoves his hand away. Insulted, the Warden angrily turns and gestures to the  Hangman, who pulls the lever. The trapdoor DROPS AWAY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NOOO!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Connell DROPS through the hole. The rope pays out. Then JERKS TAUGHT. O'Connell's body SNAPS at the end of the ro But he's still alive, because --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His neck did not break! Good! Now we  watch him strangle to death.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The prisoners go ape-shit, SCREAMING and SHOUTING in ange The GUARDS look around, nervous. O'Connell struggles at t end of the rope, gagging. Evelyn is horrified, she quickl turns to the warden, leans forward and whispers in his ea

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He knows the location to Hamunaptra.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The warden spins around and faces her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You lie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I would never!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the end of the rope, O'Connell is choking and gagging turning several shades of red. The Warden stares at Evely

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you saying this filthy godless  son of a pig knows where to find The  City Of The Dead? Truly?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes and if you cut him down, we will  give you ten percent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fifty percent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twenty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evelyn hesitates, bites her lip. O'Connell's eyes bulge a he looks up at her, he can't believe this girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give... give him... give him GLAAAA-- !

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twenty-five percent, and not one  single farthing more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The warden flashes a big green smile, then YELLS in Arabi A scimitar SLASHES the air. The rope is CUT. O'Connell CR to the ground. Half dead. Rolls over. GAGGING. All of the prisoners BURST INTO CHEERS. O'Connell looks u at Evelyn. She smiles broadly and waves down at him.

dialogues.speaker: CURATOR'S OFFICE
dialogues.text: CANDLE LIGHT FLICKERS across the Curator's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She must die.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Standing in the shadows across from his desk are THREE MU blue tinted skin, hideous facial tattoos, -- the works. O of the Mumia has a rusty metal HOOK for a hand. He shrugs

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She is like all the others. She will  die in the desert.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! She has seen too much. She knows  too much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Curator leans across his desk, fear in his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not only does she have a map, but  she has the key.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spooks the hell out of the Mumia guys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The key!? She has the lost key!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. No one has ever had so much,  been so close. We must stop her, or  it will be the end of us all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then we will kill her, we will kill  her and all those with her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And burn the map and retrieve the  key.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It will be done. But what of the  American expedition? They leave  tomorrow as well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget the bumbling Americans, they  will be like all the others. Without  the map to guide them, how can they  possibly find Hamunaptra?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SMASH CUT TO: our old traitorous friend BENI.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is three days down the Nile, then  two days by camel, sahibs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WE CRANE BACK: to reveal Beni standing on the bow of a  PASSENGER BARGE. Surrounded by DANIELS, HENDERSON and BUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For all the money we're paying you,  something better god-damned well be  under that sand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WE KEEP CRANING BACK: as Henderson slaps Daniels on the b

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Hamunaptra," Daniels, that's all ya  gotta keep sayin, to yourself,  "Hamunaptra."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now we see all of GIZA PORT: Team of explorers swarm the  docks. Across the Nile, the PYRAMIDS spike the sky. Evely and Jonathan walk along the boardwalk besieged by HAWKERS selling everything from toy tombs to King Tut action figu

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you really think he'll show up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Undoubtedly, I know the breed, he  may be a cowboy, but his word is his  word.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Personally, I think he's filthy,  rude and a complete scoundrel. I  don't like him one bit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anyone I know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They both turn. O'Connell walks up; shaved, showered, spi and polished, with a new haircut and clothes. He looks mo dashing and handsome than ever. Evelyn is suitably impres

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh... um,... hello.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jonathan grabs O'Connell's arm and shakes his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smashing day for the start of an  adventure, eh, O'Connell?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Connell quickly checks his pockets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, sure, smashing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He finds his wallet and relaxes. DIRECTLY ABOVE HIM: on t bow of the barge, Burns wipes his bifocals and turns to B

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're sure Hamunaptra is out there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Along with the scorched bones of my  entire garrison, sahib.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And that's when Beni spots O'Connell. Beni shakes his hea as if seeing a mirage, then starts backing away from the  men.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A thousand pardons, my good sahibs  but there is much work to be done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beni quickly scurries off, vanishing down into the hold. BACK DOWN WITH: Evelyn, recovering, she clears her throat

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mister O'Connell, can you look me in  the eye, and guarantee me this is  not some sort of flimflam? Because  if it is, I'm warning you --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Connell steps up close to Evelyn, invading her space lo her straight in the eye. Evelyn doesn't back away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All I can tell you, miss, is that my  Colonel found that map in an ancient  fortress, and the whole damn garrison  believed in it so much, that without  orders, we marched halfway across  Libya and into Egypt to find that  city. Like I told ya, all I saw was  sand. Everybody else was wiped out  by Tuareg warriors. I'll take your  bags.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Connell takes her bags and heads up the gangplank and o the same passenger barge that Beni and the Americans are Evelyn's eyes follow him, a bit wistfully. Jonathan sees

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, yes, you're right, filthy, rude,  a complete scoundrel, nothing to  like there at all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evelyn gives him a look. Jonathan just grins. And that's  when the warden suddenly brushes past, tipping his ragged hat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bright good morning to all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have come to protect my investment,  thank you very much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And up the plank he goes. Evelyn and Jonathan share a loo WE GO WIDE AGAIN: as the barge pulls out and heads down t Nile. WE TILT UP: to the SUN, which then DISSOLVES into -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The MOON, shining down on the desert. The THREE VICIOUS M quietly glide a narrow skiff out onto the river. The one  with the hook sits in the middle of the skiff, the other row, heading for the PASSENGER BARGE coming their way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jonathan and the three Americans are playing poker. O'Con comes out a door carrying a GUNNY-SACK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sit down, O'Connell, sit down, we  could use another good player.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I only gamble with my life, never my  money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never? What if I were to wager five  hundred dollars says we get to  Hamunaptra before you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Connell returns Daniel's cocky look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yer on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burns slips on his dirty bifocals.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What makes you so confident, sir?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What makes you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henderson spits a wad of chew into a spittoon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We got us a man who's actually been  there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Connell's poker face drops, perplexed. Same with Jonath

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I say, what a coincidence, why --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Connell 'accidentally' hits him in the ribs with the  gunnysack, shutting him up. Jonathan quickly covers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- whose deal is it? Is it my deal?  I thought I just dealt?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evelyn sits on a table, staring out over the passing rive The gunny-sack DROPS onto the table, startling her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, didn't mean to scare ya.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The only thing that scares me, Mister  O'Connell, are your manners.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still angry that I kissed ya, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you call that a kiss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Connell reaches into the gunny-sack and starts pulling revolvers, pistols, hunting knives, a massive elephant gu and a half dozen carefully wrapped sticks of dynamite.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did I miss something? Are we going  into battle?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The last time I was at that place  everybody I was with died.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This takes the smile off Evelyn's face. O'Connell starts  dismantling and cleaning the guns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's something out there, you  know, something under that sand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I'm hoping to find a certain  artifact, a book, actually, my brother  thinks there's treasure. What do you  think is out there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Connell looks into Evelyn's eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evil. The Tuaregs and the Bedouin  believe that Hamunaptra is cursed,  they call it, "the doorway to hell."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ahmar is Ossirion. "Passageway to  the underworld", actually.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She gives him a know-it-all grin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't believe in fairy tales and  hokum, Mister O'Connell, but I do  believe that one of the most famous  books in history is buried out there,  The Book Of The Living. It's what  first interested me in Egypt as a  child. It's why I came here, sort of  a life's pursuit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the fact that they say it's made  out of pure gold, makes no nevermind  to you, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evelyn is surprised by his knowledge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know your history.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know my treasure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evelyn gets up to go, then she hesitates, nervous, she tu back to O'Connell, and as matter-of-fact as possible says

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By the way,... why did you kiss me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Connell, cleaning his guns, just shrugs his shoulders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was about to be hanged, seemed  like a good idea at the time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evelyn's eyes widen, furious, she turns and storms off. O'Connell looks up, watching her leave, a bit perplexed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?... Wha'd I say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then he hears someone SNICKERING under the table. He quic reaches down, grabs that someone and lifts him up. It's B

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My very good friend! What a surprise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why if it ain't my little buddy,  Beni. I oughta kill you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Connell sticks a knife under Beni's throat. Beni swallo hard, then tries to weasel his way out with a big grin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You never were any good with the  ladies, O'Connell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you're the one leading the  Americans, I shoulda figured. So  what's the scam? You get 'em out in  the middle of the desert then leave  'em to rot?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unfortunately no, these Americans  are smart, they pay me only half  now, half when I get them back to  Cairo, so I must go all the way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Connell pulls the knife away. Beni relaxes, rubs his ne

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You never believed in Hamunaptra,  O'Connell. Why are you going back?  The devil himself lives out there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They look as they hear Evelyn YELP. A single CAMEL in the HORSE PADDOCK takes another bite at her. She YELPS again backs away. O'Connell grins as Evelyn flees down the deck

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The girl saved my life, figured it  was the least I could do, keep her  out of trouble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You always did have more balls than  brains.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Connell's eyes narrow at the insult, he looks back at B

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's make us even, shall we?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Connell grabs him and chucks him over the side of the b Beni SPLASHES into the river. O'Connell takes his gunny-s and starts walking off down the deck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Connell! I am going to kill you  for this!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sounds familiar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And that's when he spots THREE SETS OF WET FOOTPRINTS, co up over the railing from the river and heading down the d O'Connell quickly looks around, immediately on the alert.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evelyn, wearing a nightgown, stands in front of a mirror. She gives her head a good shake, letting her hair fall lo over her bare shoulders. Then she turns around, RIGHT THE IS ONE OF THE HIDEOUS MUMIA! It's Hook. He slams his hand over her mouth and lifts up his hook, ready to strike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is the map?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evelyn's terrified eyes glance down. Hook looks over, see the map lying next to a flickering candle on a nearby tab

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the key? Where is the key?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evelyn's eyes look confused. She shakes her head. Hook gr

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then I'll find it myself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He cocks his hook, about to kill her. And that's when the door is KICKED OPEN. O'Connell BURSTS IN, gun in each han Hook spins Evelyn around and holds her out in front of hi O'Connell looks at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Friend of yours?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evelyn's eyes widen. And that's when the candle on the ta FLICKERS. Everything happens at once, READ FAST: O'Connel spins around just as a window BURSTS OPEN. A Mumia leans FIRES A GUN. Woodchips BLAST OFF the wall next to O'Conne head. He returns FIRE. Kills the Mumia. The Mumia falls b FIRING BLINDLY. A LANTERN in the room is BLASTED. Kerosen SPLASHES across the wall. BURSTS INTO FLAMES. Evelyn grab the candle on the table and JAMS IT back over her shoulde right into Hook's EYE. He SCREECHES in pain and lets her O'Connell grabs her and YANKS her out of the FLAMING ROOM

dialogues.speaker: HALLWAY
dialogues.text: O'Connell pulls Evelyn down the hall, she tries to jerk f

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The map! We need the map!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He shoves her up against a wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Relax! I'm the map! (taps his forehead) It's all up here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh that's comforting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Connell gives her a look, then pulls her forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, there's still one more of  those guys around here somewhere.

dialogues.speaker: EVELYN'S FLAMING ROOM
dialogues.text: Hot melted wax covers Hook's face as he holds his sore ey and struggles to the door. Then he notices the key/box on the floor. He bends over to pick it up. And that's when t door is KICKED OPEN again, it hits him in the ass and kno him into the fire. Jonathan leans in. Sees nothing but fl

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EVY!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then he sees the key/box on the floor and picks it up. A  HAND suddenly snatches the key/box away from him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey that's mine --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Hook. His backside is now ON FIRE. He lifts his pist Jonathan quickly backpedals out the door as Hook OPENS FI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Connell and Evelyn race out onto the deck near the hors paddock. People are SCREAMING and SHOUTING, lots of panic BLAM! A chunk of the wall is BLOWN OFF next to Evelyn's h O'Connell pivots and FIRES BACK. It's the last Mumia, on other side of the paddock. He and O'Connell exchange GUNF Another LANTERN BURSTS INTO FLAMES. O'Connell SHOOTS OFF paddock lock. The horses go nuts. O'Connell FIRES over th heads. They CHARGE FORWARD and CRASH through the door. Th Mumia SCREAMS as the horses STAMPEDE over him. FLAMES swe up the walls and race across the roof. Half the barge is ON FIRE. O'Connell throws the gunny-sack over his shoulde

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you swim?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well of course I can swim, if the  occasion calls for it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trust me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He picks her up and throws her over the side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The occasion calls for it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evelyn SPLASHES into the water. O'Connell dives in after  her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jonathan runs out onto the bow, sees the three Americans, guns in every hand, fanning their pistols, SHOOTING every in sight. Jonathan just shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Americans.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hook suddenly stumbles up behind him, -- now a FLAMING TO Jonathan turns around, Hook grabs him by the throat with FLAMING ARM and pins him to the cabin wall. Jonathan's ey widen as he sees a hook rising up inside the FLAMES about strike him. The Americans pivot and OPEN FIRE. Blows Hook over the railing. Jonathan turns to the Americans and smi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I say! Good show!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then he points his thumb at himself

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And did I panic?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He lifts up his other hand, -- he has the key/box back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And that's when the horses STAMPEDE onto the bow. Jonatha dives over one side, the three Americans dive over the ot

dialogues.speaker: NILE RIVERBANK
dialogues.text: O'Connell, Evelyn, Jonathan and the Warden wade out of th water. Evelyn's nightgown clings tight to her body as she wrings it out. She looks good. O'Connell notices. Everybody else, including the horses, is getting out on t far shore O'Connell spots Beni running up to the American

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey O'Connell! Looks to me like I  got all the horses!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Beni! Looks to me like your on  the wrong side of the river!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beni looks up at the stars, then angrily KICKS the sand  CURSING. The FLAMING barge drifts off, slowly sinking...

dialogues.speaker: BEDOUIN TRADING POST
dialogues.text: O'Connell barters in ARABIC with a CAMEL TRADER at a trad post. Jonathan forks over some cash. The Trader hands the the reins of four ugly old camels.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't believe the price of these  fleabags.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We coulda had 'em for free, all we  had to do was give 'em your sister.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, awfully tempting, wasn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Awfully.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And that's when Evelyn steps out of a trading tent. She's changed into a gorgeous, tightly fitted, Bedouin dress.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then again...

dialogues.speaker: SAHARA DESERT SAND DUNES
dialogues.text: O'Connell, Evelyn, Jonathan and the warden are on camels the middle of the frying pan; the endless, sunbaked Sahar

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never did like camels. Filthy buggers.  They smell, they bite, they spit.  Disgusting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The warden savagely attacks a chicken wing with his vile  green teeth. Flies buzz around his head. He sucks at his  gums, then spits out some gristle. O'Connell watches him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, disgusting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evelyn is having the time of her life on top of her camel

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well I think they're cute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WE DO SEVERAL TIME DISSOLVES: showing the majesty of the  desert, and our heroes getting deeper and deeper into it.

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: The MOON shines down an four lone camel rider's trekking  across the vast wasteland. Jonathan is sound asleep, his head bobbing comically to t rhythm of his camel. On the camel next to him, the Warden SNORES LOUDLY. Up in front of them, Evelyn slowly starts slide off her saddle. O'Connell reaches over and stops he then gently pushes her back up onto her saddle, never wak her. For a long moment, his eyes watch Evelyn, and then h looks up at a distant ridge -- -- where Ardeth Ray and a group of MUMIA RIDERS are pacin them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dawning sun hasn't yet crested the distant horizon as Jonathan and the Warden ride alongside a giant sand dune.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you snore!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do not snore!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All night you snored!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have never snored!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Up in front of them, O'Connell looks at Evelyn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're almost there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you sure?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Connell looks down at the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pretty sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The others look down and see DOZENS OF SKELETONS sticking out of the ground. Bleached and eaten away. Some of the  skeletons look like they're trying to crawl up out of the desert floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What in bloody hell is this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Warden shivers in fear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Other seekers of Hamunaptra.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The American Expedition rides out from behind the far end the dune. The Americans are accompanied by TWO DOZEN NATI DIGGERS and an Arab EGYPTOLOGIST. Beni rides lead on a ca the rest ride horses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good morning, my friend!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Connell just nods. The two parties come to a stop a hun feet apart. O'Connell turns and stares out across the end horizon. Beni does likewise. The Americans look puzzled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, what the hell we doin'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patience, my good sahib, patience.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henderson looks over at O'Connell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First one to the city, O'Connell!  Five hundred! Cash bucks!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Connell and Beni just stare out at the flat nothingness Evelyn and Jonathan share a look. And then, the SUN start to rise in the distance, breaking the flat horizon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evelyn can feel the suspense and the majesty of the momen

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're about to be shown the way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Far off to the right, a HUGE SHAPE begins to rise with th sun. A VOLCANO. O'Connell and Beni watch it, expressionle Daniels, Henderson and Burns share a look, and then --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HEYA!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Americans take off. Racing towards the rising volcano

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SEE YA THERE, O'CONNELL!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evelyn and Jonathan give O'Connell anxious, sarcastic loo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, begging your pardon, but shouldn't  we be going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After all, you rode us night and day  to win that bet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Connell doesn't say a word, staring hard. Beni watches Americans and spits into the sand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fools.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then suddenly, the volcano SHIFTS ACROSS THE HORIZON. Passing across the sun as it goes. It's a MIRAGE. The Americans crash their horses to a stop and race the o way, after the volcano. Evelyn and Jonathan smile, amazed The volcano SHIFTS AGAIN, floating across the watery hori The Americans crash to a stop again and chase after the  volcano. All three of them confused and CURSING. O'Connel and Beni just stare, waiting. The volcano SHIFTS AGAIN. A the Americans crash to a stop again. Burns is THROWN from his horse. Henderson angrily rips his hat off and chucks to the ground. Daniels just curses as they give up the ch The volcano comes to a stop on the far left of the horizo The Americans are on the far right. Nothing moves. A BEAT And then O'Connell grins. So does Beni. They share a look And then SWAT their camels and RACE AWAY. Everybody else  hauls-ass after them. O'Connell and Beni are neck-and-nec And then Evelyn comes galloping up, hair flying in the wi Beni takes out his camel whip and starts WHIPPING O'Conne Trying to knock him off his camel. once. CRACK! Twice. CR But on the third try O'Connell grabs the whip and JERKS B off his camel. Beni SLAMS to the ground and TUMBLES. Evelyn and O'Connell race across the desert. Evelyn has n felt so alive. She LAUGHS. O'Connell grins; he likes this girl. Beni stumbles to his feet, then quickly dances out the way as Jonathan and all the other riders stampede pas him. Evelyn beats O'Connell to the stone ramp, racing har

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evelyn! Slow down!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evelyn ignores him as she races up the ramp towards the g

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SLOW DOWN, EVELYN! SLOW DOWN! THERE'S  A REALLY BIG --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evelyn goes ass-over-teacups through the air and crash la in a sand dune. She sits up, stunned, sandy hair in her e O'Connell stops at the edge of the ramp next to her camel

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Americans ride up and look in wonder at the ruins ins the volcano. O'Connell gives them a big, shit-eating grin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You boys owe me five hundred dollars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Under the guidance of the Egyptologist, the Diggers are b hauling rock and dirt out of the Temple doorway. The thre Americans are playing poker. Beni smokes a hookah and swa flies. Dozens of stray CAMELS roam the decrepit city; dus backpacks and old saddlebags still slung over their humps

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where'd all these camels come from?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They belong to the dead. They will  wait years for their masters to return  before leaving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Connell, Evelyn, Jonathan and the Warden are working ne to a narrow CREVICE, which weaves it's way through the ru O'Connell ties a rope around a pillar and throws the rest the coils into the crevice, about to rappel down. Jonatha bends over to have a look, his ass hits something, he YEL and backs away. It's the decrepit FACE OF ANUBIS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That thing gives me the creeps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be nice. That thing saved my life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evelyn is positioning ancient MIRRORS along the crevice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That "thing" gets me excited.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sarcastic) The things that get you excited.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: According to Bembridge Scholars,  inside the statue of Anubis was a  secret compartment, perhaps containing  The Book Of The Living.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are those mirrors for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ancient Egyptian trick. You'll see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Connell shrugs, then rappels down into the crevice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Connell waves a TORCH as Jonathan, Evelyn and the warde drop down next to him. Evelyn peers into the spooky darkn

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you realize, we are standing inside  a room that no one has entered in  over four thousand years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who cares? I don't see no treasure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're welcome to my share of the  spider webs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And it stinks to high heaven in here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evelyn just rolls her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cretins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jonathan sniffs the foul air, then he looks at the warden and realizes where the smell is coming from. He stops  sniffing. Evelyn brushes COBWEBS away from a METAL DISK on the wall then repositions it on it's pedestal, aiming it at a RAY LIGHT shining in from the outer mirrors. -- THE RAY OF LI

dialogues.speaker: DISK TO ANOTHER UNTIL THE WHOLE CHAMBER IS LIT UP. LIGHT
dialogues.text: RAYS SHOOT OFF DOWN THE PASSAGEWAYS. It's the embalmer's  chamber.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That is a neat trick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my god, It's a preparation room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Preparation for what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For entering the afterlife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Connell quickly draws his gun. Jonathan gently nudges h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mummies, my good son, this is where  they made the mummies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evelyn heads down a narrow passageway. The others follow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Connell, Evelyn and Jonathan crouch as they make their through a narrow, COBWEB INFESTED LABYRINTH. The short, s warden can stand straight up. Then they hear something an freeze. It sounds like somebody is clawing inside the wal They share looks. Then slowly move forward. Getting darke and darker as they go. The strange sound getting louder a louder. And then it stops. Evelyn holds her breath. Jonat licks his lips. O'Connell cocks his pistol. The warden FA O'Connell, Jonathan and Evelyn glare at him.

dialogues.speaker: ANUBIS' CHAMBER
dialogues.text: They slowly creep out of the labyrinth and up to the foot an enormous half-buried statue. The lower half of Anubis. Then they hear the sound again, coming closer now, from t other side of the statue. And closer. O'Connell pulls Eve behind him. And closer. O'Connell raises his gun. And CLO O'Connell LEAPS OUT. -- THREE HORRIBLE SWEATY FACES LUNGE HIM. O'Connell REACTS. But doesn't pull the trigger becau it's just the Americans, their guns are up, cocked and ai

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ya scared the bejeezus out of us,  O'Connell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Likewise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But nobody lowers their guns. Daniels grins, the tough on

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This here is our statue,... friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't see your name on it,... pal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And that's when Beni, five Diggers and the Egyptologist s out of the shadows, -- all holding guns aimed at O'Connel

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ten to one, O'Connell, your odds are  no-so-good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've had worse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jonathan clenches a tiny derringer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, me too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Connell gives him a sideways glance. Beni cocks his gun grinning, he wants it to happen. The tension thickens. Th Evelyn gently takes O'Connell's gun hand and pulls it dow

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's be nice, children, if we're  going to play together, we must learn  to share.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evelyn pulls O'Connell away. Jonathan and the Warden foll Beni and the Americans slowly lower their guns, laughing. The Egyptologist excitedly begins translating the hierogl

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Connell and Jonathan are using sledge-hammers against t ceiling. Evelyn is gently chipping away with a tiny chise

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: According to my calculations, we  should be right under the statue.  We'll come up right between his legs. (she blushes and laughs) Oh my.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And when those dirty Yanks go to  sleep -- (looks at O'Connell) No offense.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: None taken.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll sneak up and steal that book  right out from under them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you're sure you can find the  secret compartment?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, if their Egyptologist hasn't  already found it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jonathan looks around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I say, what's our smelly little friend  got himself up to?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Warden crawls into a DARK CHAMBER and LIGHTS A TORCH. A mural wall comes alive. Embedded into it are dozens of  black amethyst SCARABS; glittering images of the sacred  beetles. Awestruck, the Warden pulls out a pocket knife a starts prying away at one of the precious bugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beni and the Americans hover around the Egyptologist, who found the SECRET COMPARTMENT inside Anubis. The Egyptolog brushes sand away from the seam. Henderson steps forward grabs the seam, -- the Egyptologist quickly stops him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seti was no fool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henderson sees the intense look in the Egyptologist's eye

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, sure...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks back at the native Diggers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll let him open it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
