dialogues.text: The Egyptologist nods, then YELLS IN EGYPTIAN at the Digg The Diggers hesitate, filled with fear. Daniels pulls out his gun, aims it at three of the Diggers. The three Digge hesitantly step forward with crowbars and stick them into the seams. The other Diggers back away, scared shitless. Beni and the Americans exchange looks, and then they back away as well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three Heroes are still digging into the ceiling

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lemme get this straight, they stuck  a sharp, red hot poker up your nose,  cut your brain into small pieces,  then ripped it all out through your  nostrils?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OWCH! That's really got to hurt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's called mummification. You're  dead when they do this

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, that'd bring you back to life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You two are worse than a couple of  schoolboys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And that's when a huge chunk of the roof suddenly GIVES O O'Connell GRABS Evelyn and JERKS her clear. Jonathan DIVE for the far wall. A MASSIVE STONE CASEMENT DROPS OUT OF T CEILING AND CRASHES to the floor. DUST FLIES. Fills the r

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Having heard the crash, Beni and the Americans have their guns pointed at the floor. The Egyptologist could care le he looks at the Diggers, gripping their crowbars, and YEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FENI!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The three Diggers PULL HARD. The ancient seams start to g The Egyptologist YELLS again. The Diggers PULL HARDER. Th compartment starts to loosen. Again he YELLS. The Diggers give one final pull and --

dialogues.speaker: -- AN INTENSE BURST OF LIQUID SPRAYS OUT OF THE SEAM. HIT
dialogues.text: THE THREE DIGGERS. MELTS THEIR SKIN CLEAN OFF. They SCREA Dying horribly. HALF SKELETAL by the time they hit the  ground...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dust is starting to clear. O'Connell, Evelyn and Jona slowly get up and step over to the massive stone casement We immediately recognize it as IMHOTEP'S SARCOPHAGUS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my god,... it looks like, it looks  like a sarcophagus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why would they bury somebody in the  ceiling?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They didn't, they buried him at the  foot of Anubis. He was either someone  of great importance. Or he did  something very naughty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The warden drops an amethyst-scarab into his pouch, then  greedily starts prying away at another. It rips off, he d it into his pouch, -- only he misses, and this scarab qui falls to the sandy floor without the Warden noticing. CLOSE ON: the scarab on the floor. It begins to TRANSFORM The amethyst starts to glow. Something inside starts to  WIGGLE; as if the amethyst were some sort of strange coco Then it splits open and a real live hideous SCARAB BEETLE scurries out. It races over to the warden's shoe, quickly burrows into the leather and vanishes inside. The Warden's eyes FLY OPEN. He starts to SCREAM, drops hi knife and frantically starts clawing away at his pant leg higher and higher until he rips open his shirt revealing large, hideous LUMP, BURROWING UNDER HIS SKIN. IT BURROWS IT'S WAY UP HIS FAT BELLY AND ACROSS HIS HAIRY CHEST. The Warden claws and scratches at it, trying to stop it. The  lump BURROWS UP HIS NECK. The Warden starts GAGGING and  COUGHING. And then the scarab-lump VANISHES INTO HIS HEAD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our Heroes clear the dirt off the top of the sarcophagus, revealing a single, ominous hieroglyph. Evelyn stares at Jonathan impatiently strums his fingers across the lid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well?... Who is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evelyn stares at the hieroglyph, confused and concerned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'He that shall not be named.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Connell dusts off the huge LOCK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's some sort of lock here. You  say these thing's are made of granite  with a steel interior?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quarried granite with a cobalt lining.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoever's in here, sure wasn't getting  out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No kiddin', without a key, it'll  take us a month to crack this thing,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A key! That's it! That's what he was  talking about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who was talking about what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evelyn starts rummaging through the pack on Jonathan's ba

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The man on the barge. The one with  the hook, he was looking for a key.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evelyn pulls out the key/box. Jonathan tries to take it b

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey that's mine!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evelyn slaps his hand and quickly unfolds the box, -- it' now shaped exactly like the LOCK'S KEYHOLE. Evelyn smiles And that's when they hear the Warden's SCREAMS echoing th the labyrinth. All three of them turn and take-off runnin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Warden is SCREAMING and dancing insanely around the  labyrinth, totally freaked from the extreme pain in his h O'Connell, Evelyn and Jonathan run up just as the Warden  starts RIPPING his own hair out of his head. O'Connell an Jonathan grab at the Warden's hands, but he's far too cra he shoves them aside, runs full bore down the length of t labyrinth and SLAMS his head straight into a rock wall. T Warden drops to the ground. Dead as lead. Eyes wide open. O'Connell, Evelyn and Jonathan just stand there staring,  breathing hard, wide-eyed themselves...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evelyn and Jonathan are nuzzled up to a campfire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you suppose killed him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you ever see him eat?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Connell comes up over some rocks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seems the Americans had a little  misadventure of their own today,  three of their diggers were killed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Salt acid. Pressurized salt acid.  Some sort of ancient booby-trap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe this place really is cursed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A GUST OF WIND blows through the camp. The campfire FLICKERS O'Connell and Jonathan share a nerv look. Evelyn laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You two!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't believe in curses, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I believe if I can see it and I  can touch it, then it's real. That's  what I believe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Connell cocks his rifle, KA-CHANK! Gives her a big grin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I believe in being prepared.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jonathan opens the Warden's POUCH, the one that held the  scarabs. He reaches in, starts scrounging around. WE SLOW PUSH IN. Waiting for the attack. THE MUSIC BUILDS. And th Jonathan SCREAMS in pain and RIPS his hand back out of th pouch. O'Connell and Evelyn both jump.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHAT?! WHAT IS IT?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jonathan sucks his finger, then reaches back into the pou and pulls out a LIQUOR BOTTLE, the top has been chipped o

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seagrams!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jonathan smiles at the bottle, then turns the pouch insid out and shakes it, nothing but SAND is inside it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, he may have been a stinky  fellow,... but he had good taste.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jonathan takes a swig. O'Connell and Evelyn laugh, guilti And then O'Connell suddenly kneels down and sticks his ea to the sand. Evelyn and Jonathan watch him. A BEAT. And t a BARAGE OF GUNFIRE IS HEARD coming from the American cam O'Connell jumps up and throws the elephant gun to Evelyn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes off running through the ruins. Evelyn immediatel gets up and runs after him. Jonathan grabs a gun, holds t bottle of Seagrams; tight and dashes after her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evy! Excuse me! But didn't the man  just say -- !

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The American camp is under siege. Two dozen MUMIA RIDERS  gallop through. FIRING RIFLES. Several Diggers are killed they run. The Americans leap out of their tents FIRING. K multiple Riders. Daniels is shot, spins and falls, keeps  SHOOTING. Henderson and Burns run to his aid, BLASTING AW O'Connell races through the ruins and SLAMS right into Be who is obviously trying to high-tail-it out of there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goin' somewhere?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just looking for you, O'Connell! I  wanted to be with my friend!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Connell drags him back towards the American camp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (struggling) Why do you like to fight so much?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Cause I look good doin, it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ardeth Ray gallops through the camp, cutting Diggers down with his scimitar. O'Connell runs up on top of some rocks LEAPS OUT and TACKLES him off his horse. The two men SLAM the ground. O'Connell spins up onto one knee and FIRES, p blank. Blows the scimitar out of Ardeth Ray's hand. O'Con is about to shoot again when a horse rides up between the A scimitar swoops down, almost takes O'Connell's head off misses him by an inch. O'Connell leaps up and blows the R off his mount. The horse BOLTS. -- But Ardeth Ray is gone Evelyn hides behind some rocks, watching the scene, sudde she hears something coming up behind her and spins around A vicious tattooed Mumia Rider races at her. Evelyn quick backpedals over the rocks, terrified. The Mumia Rider rai his scimitar, about to strike. Evelyn SCREAMS, trips over a rock and FIRES the elephant  gun, -- BLAM! Blows the Rider off his mount and CATAPULTS him twenty feet back into some ruins. At the same time, the kick blows Evelyn off her feet and  over a ridge. She FLAILS through the air and lands in a s dune. Jonathan and some Diggers are holding their own near the  temple door. Four Riders come CHARGING right at them. Jonathan takes a swig off the Seagrams.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let 'em have it, boys!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jonathan and the Diggers OPEN FIRE. When the smoke clears the Riders are either dead or gone. Jonathan grins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I say, bloody good show.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then several more Mumia leap off the temple and land  behind them. Jonathan and the remaining Diggers spin arou and suddenly find themselves in hand-to-hand combat. O'Connell is quickly loading his pistol. He hears somethi THUNDERING UP behind him. He spins around just as Ardeth on a horse swings his scimitar. O'Connell instinctively r his hands to protect his face, the scimitar STRIKES! Hits his gun, -- CHING! O'Connell's gun flips away. Disar O'Connell dives and rolls and suddenly comes up with a st of dynamite in his hand. He shoves the fuse into a fire. IGNITES. He faces Ardeth Ray, towering above him. The two men lock eyes. The fuse continues to burn down. Ardeth Ra points his scimitar at O'Connell's head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LEAVE THIS PLACE!... LEAVE THIS PLACE  OR DIE!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ardeth Ray GALLOPS OFF. The remaining Mumia Riders race a him, vanishing into the night. O'Connell watches them lea then turns to the burning fuse,... and blows it out. Evel staggers up, looking very shaken. O'Connell gently takes and holds her close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You alright?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evelyn looks up into his strong eyes. It's the first time he's shown genuine concern for her. And she likes it. He' also holding her a little too close. And she likes that t

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes,... fine,... thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beni crawls out from under some pillars as Henderson and  Burns help Daniels to his feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See! That proves it! Old Seti's  fortune's gotta be under this sand!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For them to protect it like this,  you just know there's got to be  treasure down there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Connell looks up into the surrounding ridges, unsatisfi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These men are a desert people. They  value water, not gold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evelyn looks at O'Connell, suddenly very worried.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Jonathan?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jonathan falls into FRAME. Hits the ground. Eyes wide ope Mouth agape. Clearly dead. A BEAT. And then his eyes clos and his mouth widens into a goofy smile. Shit-faced drunk O'Connell and Evelyn laugh, both half-in-the-bag themselv the bottle of Seagrams is almost gone. O'Connell offers t bottle to Evelyn, she waves it away, slurring badly --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unlike my brother, sir, I know when  to say no.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Connell polishes off the bottle and chucks it away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unlike your brother, Miss, you I  don't get. You're a whole new brew.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, you're wondering, what's a  place like me doing in a girl like  this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Egypt is in my blood. My father was  a famous explorer, he loved Egypt so  much that he married an Egyptian. My  mother! Who was quite an adventurer  herself

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, I get your father, I get your  mother and I get your brother, but  what are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evelyn is insulted, she staggers to her feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I may not be an explorer, or an  adventurer, or a treasure hunter, or  a gunfighter! Mister O'Connell But  I'm proud of what I am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what is that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evelyn plops back down beside him, really drunk, she grin and proudly lifts her head high.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...I am a librarian!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She leans in, very close to his face, looks him in the ey

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to kiss you, Mister  O'Connell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No you're not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not unless you call me Rick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why would I do that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because that's my name.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She gives him a goofy smile. He leans forward and KISSES  HER. Evelyn's eyes slowly close. And then she passes out, slumping into his arms. O'Connell looks down at her, and  just smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evelyn's HAND slips the KEY into the sarcophagus, lock an turns it. A series of STRANGE MECHANICAL-LIKE SOUNDS are  heard, and then the sarcophagus unlocks with a GIANT HISS O'Connell, Evelyn and Jonathan all look very, very hungov They start to slide the heavy lid off the sarcophagus. PUSHING, SHOVING and GROANING, the lid budging, inch by i

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't believe I allowed the two of  you to get me drunk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't blame me, I don't even remember  being there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well neither do I, thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Connell gives her a hurt look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evelyn gives O'Connell a nervous look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No... Why?... Should I?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gee, yeah, you told me it was the  best time you ever had.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Connell gives her a big cheesy smile. Evelyn's face dro appalled and embarrassed. And that's when the lid FALLS O and LOUDLY CRASHES to the ground. All three of them insta grab their sore heads and MOAN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Several fear-filled, sweaty-faced Diggers reach into the  secret compartment. Henderson and Burns hold guns on them Daniels has his arm in a sling. The Diggers slowly pull o the ORNATE CHEST. They set the chest down on the sandy fl Beni watches as the Egyptologist translates the hieratics

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a curse upon this chest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Curse my ass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, who cares.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Egyptologist gives them the evil-eye

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In these hallowed grounds, that which  was set forth in ancient times, is  as strong today, as it was then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, yeah, okay, what's it --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Egyptologist slowly and carefully reads the inscripti

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Death will come on swift wings to  whomever opens this chest".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A GUST OF WIND blows through the chamber. TORCHES FLICKER All the Diggers suddenly turn tail and run off SCREAMING. The Americans look at each other, suddenly very nervous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It says, there is one, the undead,  who if brought back to life, is bound  by sacred law to consummate this  curse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well, let's just make sure we  don't bring anybody back from the  dead then, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The three Americans laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He will kill all who open this  chest,... and assimilate their organs  and fluids.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Assimilate their organs and fluids?  Ya mean eat 'em?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And in so doing he will regenerate.  And no longer be the undead, but a  plague upon this earth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The WIND WHISTLES. Torches FLICKER. VERY SPOOKY. Beni and the Egyptologist share a fear-filled look. Henderson just shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah hell, let's open it anyways.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHAM! Imhotep's wooden coffin is DROPPED to the ground ne to his stone sarcophagus. Evelyn is very excited.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my god, I've dreamed about this  ever since I was a little girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You dream about dead guys?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evelyn just gives him a look, then starts brushing dirt a cobwebs off the top of the coffin. Then she freezes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, all the sacred spells have  been chiseled off. The hieratics and  hieroglyphs that protect the deceased  on his journey into the afterlife,  they've been removed. This man was  cursed,... doomed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Connell and Jonathan are too excited to care.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tough break.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I'm all tears, now let's see  who's inside, shall we?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evelyn can't believe these guys. Jonathan inserts the key into the coffin's lock. Turns it. The lid cracks open wit HISS. They all react to the FOUL STENCH. Then O'Connell g the lid. It's stuck. He pulls with all his might. Jonatha helps him. It starts to give way. Slowly. Slowly. Slooooo And then it suddenly POPS OPEN and THE MOST HIDEOUS, MAGG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AHHHHH!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all jump back. Scared to death. Imhotep is now the  'Elephant Man' of corpses; twisted and deformed. The year have not been kind. He slumps back into his coffin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henderson and Daniels start to pry at the lid of the wood chest. Beni and the Egyptologist watch. In the background Beni starts backing away, filled with fear, sweating buck

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The curse,... beware the curse!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beni turns and bolts from the chamber. Daniels spits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stupid superstitious bastard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And that's when the seal breaks, -- A BLACK VAPOR BLASTS OF THE CHEST. Everybody vanishes into the strange cloud.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Connell, Evelyn and Jonathan slowly creep forward and  carefully look back inside Imhotep's coffin, creeped-out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is he supposed to look like that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I've never seen a mummy look  like this. He's, he's still...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Juicy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. He's more than four thousand  years old and still decomposing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And look at this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Connell points at the inside of the COFFIN LID, where t are FINGERNAIL SCRATCHES and DRIED BLOOD all over the ins

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my god, he was buried alive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This sends a chill through everyone. Evelyn leans in clos

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And he left a message.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WE PUSH IN on a grouping of hieratics WRITTEN IN BLOOD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It says: 'Death is only the  beginning.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jonathan shivers. O'Connell looks around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's my gun?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you going to do? Shoot him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If he decides to wake up, hell yes!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The vapor is settling. The Americans have their guns aime at the chest. The Egyptologist slowly steps up, reaches  inside, and lifts out a heavy burlap bag. Everyone's eyes widen in excitement as he sticks his hand into the bag an slowly pulls out the black BOOK OF THE DEAD, the same boo Imhotep used in his attempt to bring Anck-su-namun back t life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have heard told of this book, but  I never truly believed it existed.  This, good gentlemen, is a most  priceless treasure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henderson kicks the sandy floor in anger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wouldn't trade ya for a brass  spittoon!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah! It's supposed to be made outta  pure gold!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniels kicks the chest. It breaks open, unfolding to rev a lower compartment. Inside, are Anck-su-namun's FIVE JEW ENCRUSTED CANOPIC JARS (one is shattered and without jewe

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two camps have now joined together. O'Connell and Ben are roasting chunks of hairy meat over a fire. Jonathan  wrinkles his nose, disgusted by the smell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is this stuff? It smells like  our late friend, the Warden.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Connell and Beni both grin. Jonathan looks horrified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You did not!?... We're not!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rat gizzards. They smell bad and  taste worse, but that's the best the  desert has to offer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The gloating Americans sit down, fondling their jeweled j

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say O'Connell, whadaya think these  honey's'll fetch back home?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hear you gentlemen found yerselves  a nice gooey mummy. Congratulations.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ya know if ya dry him out, you can  sell him for firewood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Americans laugh. Evelyn walks up, sits down and drops pile of big dusty BUG SKELETONS onto the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scarabs, flesh eaters, I found them  inside our friend's coffin. They can  stay alive for years living off the  flesh of a corpse, or in this case...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She shrugs, then looks at the roasting meat

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Famished.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Connell and Jonathan stare at the bug skeletons, disgus

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you saying somebody threw these  things in with our guy, and they  slowly ate him alive?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very slowly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He certainly was not a popular fellow  when they planted him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Must of got a little too frisky with  the Pharaoh's daughter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: According to my readings, our friend  suffered the HOM-DAI, the worst of  all ancient Egyptian curses, one  reserved for only the most evil  blasphemers. In all of my research,  I've never read of this curse actually  having been performed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That bad huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, they never used it because they  feared it so. It's written, that if  a victim of the HOM-DAI should ever  arise, he would bring with him the  ten plagues of Egypt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ten plagues?... You mean all ten  plagues.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like what that Moses guy did to that  Pharaoh guy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's one way of putting it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's see, there was frogs, flies,  locusts...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hail and fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun turning black.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Water turning to blood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And my personal favorite: people  covered in boils and sores.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the men share nervous looks, really spooked. Evelyn j laughs at them, then pulls a meat stick out of the fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fried gizzard anyone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Having just freshened up for bed, Evelyn exits the temple and steps past the sleeping Diggers. She spots the  Egyptologist, his jeweled canopic jar snug under one arm, the Book Of The Dead laying loose under the other. Evelyn stares at the Book, nervously biting her lip, then she sn over, carefully steals it, and quickly tip-toes away. Lying on some blankets by the campfire, O'Connell rolls o and sees Evelyn, sitting wide-eyed, staring at the Book.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sure you outta be playin, around  with that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just a book, no harm ever came  from a book.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evelyn opens the cover. THE FIRE FLICKERS. She and O'Conn share a nervous look, then Evelyn shrugs and starts readi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ahm kum Ra. Ahm kum Dei.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evelyn continues READING THE BOOK ALOUD IN ANCIENT EGYPTI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evelyn's VOICE is OVERLAID as WE START WIDE on Imhotep's  chamber and SLOWLY PUSH IN on his sarcophagus. WE PUSH IN over the lip of the coffin, then closer and closer toward Imhotep's rotten, twisted head, until his putrid face fil FRAME, -- and then suddenly his crusty eyelids Pop OPEN! Revealing EMPTY SOCKETS. -- BIG SCARY MUSIC STING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Egyptologist sits bolt upright. Quickly looks around, sees Evelyn reading the Book. He gets up and runs for her

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NO! NOOOO! YOU MUST NOT!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He skids to a stop as a strange, piercing WHINE is heard, coming from out in the desert. O'Connell and the others a leap to their feet. The Americans run out of their tents. The SOUND gets LOUDER and CLOSER. And then from out of th darkness a HUGE WALL OF LOCUSTS SWIRLS into camp and enve everyone. O'Connell grabs Evelyn, and with Jonathan at th side they race for the crevice, trying to fend off the ho vermin as they go. Beni and the Americans run for the tem The Egyptologist is covered in locusts. He stares at The  Book Of The Dead, looking haunted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What have we done?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The campfire is SUCKED UP INTO THE AIR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Connell, Evelyn and Jonathan race down the labyrinth,  slapping at themselves and picking locusts out of their h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you see that!? Grasshoppers!  Billions of grasshoppers!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's one of the plagues, right?  The grasshopper plague!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is not a plague. It's  generational. Every so many years  the locusts of Egypt have a population  explosion and they all take flight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evelyn steps forward, something SQUISHES. O'Connell lower his TORCH, -- the entire floor is FILLED WITH SLIMY FROGS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay,... and what about frogs?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Americans, Beni and the Diggers race into a passagewa Burns is knocked down, his bifocals skitter across the gr they get CRUSHED in the stampede. Burns staggers to his f squinting. BLURRY FIGURES vanish into the darkness,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniels! Henderson!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ground under O'Connell, Evelyn and Jonathan starts to SHAKE. Then suddenly, right in front of them, -- HUNDREDS CHITTERING SCARAB BEETLES BOIL UP OUT OF THE SAND. Start  scurrying towards them. Evelyn SCREAMS. Jonathan SCREAMS. Even O'Connell almost screams. They turn around and haul  ass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burns staggers down a passageway, squinting, his hands ou in front of him, groping, trying not to bump into anythin Then ten feet in front of him, a dark, blurry FIGURE step out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniels?... is that you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burns half-blindly staggers forward. The Figure doesn't m

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henderson?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burns TRIPS, stumbles forward, towards the Figure, his ha reach out and SINK INTO IMHOTEP'S PUTRID CHEST CAVITY. Bu jumps like a scalded cat, pulls his hands out and looks a them, -- HIS HANDS ARE COVERED IN MOLTEN FLESH ROT. He st to SCREAM. A SKELETAL HAND clamps over his mouth.

dialogues.speaker: LABYRINTH STAIRCASE
dialogues.text: O'Connell, Evelyn and Jonathan race up the staircase, jus ahead of the mass of SCURRYING, CHITTERING SCARABS. O'Connell leaps out onto a pedestal. Jonathan jumps up ne to him. Evelyn jumps up into a grotto on the other side o the narrow stairway. The horrible herd of vicious scarabs scurries between them, their ear-piercing CHITTERS send  shivers up Evelyn's spine. She leans back. THE WALL MOVES Evelyn falls backwards through an opening. O'Connell and  Jonathan watch the scarabs vanish up the staircase. Then  they look across the way. Evelyn is gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EVY!?

dialogues.speaker: SCARAB CHAMBER
dialogues.text: Evelyn sits up, shakes the sand out of her hair, fearfull looks around. It's almost PITCH BLACK. She gets up and fe her way along the dark walls. She rounds a corner. A shaf of MOONLIGHT filters in through a crack in the ceiling. A MAN stands in the middle of the room. Evelyn walks toward him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh thank goodness, you're one of the  Americans, aren't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just as she reaches him he turns around. It's Burns. BOTH HIS EYES ARE MISSING. He stares at her with vacant socket Evelyn SCREAMS in horror and backs away, hyperventilating she bumps into something. She SCREAMS again and spins aro It's Imhotep. With two fresh EYEBALLS in his sockets. Evelyn SCREAMS again and backs away into a wall. Her hair down, her face is dirty and sweaty, her blouse is ripped, her dress is torn, she's never looked sexier. Imhotep SQU

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anck-su-namun?

dialogues.speaker: LABYRINTH STAIRCASE
dialogues.text: O'Connell is feeling his way around inside the grotto

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn-it! Must be a trap door around  here or somethin'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then they heat MEN SCREAMING, and suddenly, Henderson Daniels and one of the Diggers come running down the stai

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RUN, YOU SONS-A-BITCHES! RUUUUN!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Connell and Jonathan join them as they hear the herd of CHITTERING scarabs coming their way. The Digger suddenly  trips and falls. O'Connell slows down, about to go back a help him. But it's too late. The Digger SCREAMS in horror the herd of scarabs run over him, eating straight through him, leaving behind the Digger's half eaten skeleton. Dan Henderson and Jonathan react in horror. O'Connell's alrea running, races right past them. The others turn and haul  ass.

dialogues.speaker: SCARAB CHAMBER
dialogues.text: Imhotep steps forward, -- the sand around him seems to  MAGNETIZE, swirling and dancing around his flaking skelet legs. Evelyn starts backing away, horrified, looks at Bur

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help me,... please,... help me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burns opens his mouth, but can only GURGLE and MOAN becau HIS TONGUE IS MISSING. Imhotep grabs him, throws him to t ground and sets his skeletal foot on Burns' chest, like a big game hunter standing on his kill. Imhotep then parts fetid lips, -- A FRESH TONGUE FLAPS BETWEEN HIS ROTTED TE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kadeesh pharos Anck-su-namun!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evelyn shivers in fear. Suddenly, O'Connell comes flying  around the corner and runs right up to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you quit playin, around! Let's  get outta here already!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Connell sees the look in her eyes and turns around, -- the sight of Imhotep, O'Connell jumps back in fright.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHOA!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Connell and Evelyn start backing away down the wall. Imhotep glides sideways with them, like a tiger cornering his prey, the sand around him SWIRLS and DANCES. Burns st to crawl away, whimpering as he goes. Imhotep suddenly st and UNHINGES his skeletal jaw, his skinless mouth stretch to an inhuman size, and he lets out a horrific, primordia SHRIEK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANCK-SU-NAMUUUUUN!!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evelyn SCREAMS. O'Connell shudders, then, embarrassed by fear, he opens his own mouth and ROARS right back at him

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ahhhhhhhh!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then BLASTS him with the elephant gun, --BLAM! Through th SMOKE AND FLAMMAGE we see Imhotep blown off his feet, his ribcage half torn away. O'Connell grabs Evelyn and runs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SAND and WIND whip through the ruins as O'Connell and Eve stumble up out of the crevice and COME FACE-TO-FACE WITH ARMED MUMIA. The Mumia quickly raise their guns. O'Connel and Evelyn quickly raise their hands. Jonathan, Henderson Daniels and the Egyptologist are already on their knees,  hands over their heads. Ardeth Ray steps forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you to leave or die, you  refused, and now you may have killed  us all. For you have unleashed the  creature that we have feared for  more than four thousand years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Relax, I got him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No mortal weapons can kill this  creature. He is not of this world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are we talkin, about the same  creature? The walking corpse? Really  big mouth? Really bad breath?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beni slowly backs up around Anubis, eyes wide, gun up. He turns around, -- IMHOTEP IS RIGHT THERE! Beni SCREAMS, ba away and OPENS FIRE. Six GUNSHOTS perforate Imhotep, but  have no effect except to SPLATTER molten flesh rot onto t back wall. Beni retreats into a corner, scared shitless. Imhotep moves forward, his one hand trying to stop the mo mummy guts from oozing out of the large shotgun hole in h side. Beni drops his gun and grabs at the CHAINS around h neck, RELIGIOUS SYMBOLS AND ICONS dangle from each chain. Beni holds the first one up: A CHRISTIAN CRUCIFIX. He qui makes the sign of-the cross and blesses himself in Englis

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: May the good Lord protect and watch  over me as a shepherd watches over  his flock. And may Satan in all his  forms be vanquished forever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It has no effect on Imhotep, who continues forward. Beni  quickly grabs at the other symbols and icons, holding the out towards Imhotep, one after the other, trying to slow progress: an Islamic Sword and Crescent Moon necklace; a  Hindu Brahma medallion; a small Buddhist Bodhisattva stat All while blessing himself in Arabic, Hindi, Chinese and  Latin. Nothing works. Imhotep's skeletal hand reaches for Beni's throat. Tears run down Beni's cheeks he's so freak And that's when he holds up THE STAR OF DAVID and blesses himself in HEBREW. Imhotep stops in his tracks. His hand  lowers. His grotesque new eyeballs stare at Beni.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (subtitled) The language of the slaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks at him quizzically. Imhotep takes a step back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Hebrew -- subtitled) I may have use for you. And the  rewards will be great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Imhotep reaches into his tattered robe, and then holds ou his fetid hand, filled with squirming MAGGOTS. Beni cring about to throw up, but then the maggots part, -- revealin tiny pile of little JEWELS. Beni's eyes widen. Imhotep ra his other hand, it holds Anck-su-namun's BROKEN CANOPIC J

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are the other sacred jars?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Several Mumia drag Burns up, he stares out with vacant  sockets. Daniels and Henderson are especially horrified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You bastards!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you do to him!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We saved him! Saved him before the  creature could finish his work. Now  leave, all of you, quickly, before  he finishes you all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not going to kill us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evelyn ELBOWS Jonathan in the ribs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We must now hunt him down, and try  and find a way to kill him, before  he consumes the earth. Allah be with  us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ardeth Ray and the Mumia start heading down into the crev O'Connell yells at them, trying to convince himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told ya, I already got him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ardeth Ray stops and looks back, deadly serious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Know this, the creature will be coming  for you. He must consummate the curse.  And until he does, he will never  eat, he will never sleep, and he  will never stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ardeth Ray turns and jumps down into the crevice,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Connell and Jonathan boost Evelyn up onto a camel. Dani and Henderson throw Burns up onto another. The Egyptologi still clutching The Book Of The Dead, gets up on yet anot They all head off into the dark, windblown desert... And then in the extreme foreground, A SKELETAL HAND SUDDE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANCK-SU-NAMUUUUUN!!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A British flag flies over BRITISH SOLDIERS manning the fr gate. Our tired, disheveled Heroes saunter up on their du camels. The Soldiers check their papers, then let them en

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A steamer trunk is slammed to the floor and thrown open. O'Connell chucks a load of DRESSES into the trunk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you didn't believe in this  stuff!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Connell heads for the closet. Evelyn UNPACKS the dresse

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Having an encounter with a four  thousand year old walking-talking  corpse tends to convert one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget it, we're out the door down  the hall and gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, we are not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Connell throws a handful of her underthings into the tr

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yes we are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Connell continues to PACK Evelyn's clothes as she conti to UNPACK them:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No we are not. We woke him up, and  we must try and stop him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We?! What we?! You didn't read that  book. I told you not to play around  with that thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright then, Me, I,... I read the  book, I woke him up and I intend to  stop him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Connell angrily stretches a bra between his hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How!? You heard the man, no mortal  weapons can kill this guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evelyn grabs the bra and throws it into a drawer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then we'll have to find some immortal  ones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There goes that belief again. Not  me, I am outta here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Connell stuffs a pile of Evelyn's shoes into the trunk. Evelyn KICKS the lid shut, slamming it on his fingers. O'Connell YELPS and angrily storms around the room suckin his fingers as Evelyn follows him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: According to that Book, once this  creature has been reborn, his curse  will spread, and as he grows in  strength, so will his curse grow,  infecting the people until the whole  of the earth is destroyed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah? So? Is that my problem?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (incredulous) It's everybody's problem!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look lady, I appreciate you saving  my life and all, but when I signed  on, I agreed to take you out there  and bring you back, and I did, now  were even, end of job, end of story,  contract terminated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what I am to you? A contract?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can either tag along with me, or  you can stay here and play around  with Mister Maggot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm staying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FINE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Connell storms out and SLAMS the door. A BEAT. Then the door opens and O'Connell's hand reaches back in and throw handful of frilly panties to the floor. SLAM goes the doo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Connell angrily strides through the compound. He sees B coming up the path with a MAN dressed in hooded robes, hi face covered by an ornate death mask. Imhotep disguised.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beni ya little stinkweed, where did  you slink off to?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You left me! You left me in the desert  to rot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah,... sorry bout that. (gestures to Imhotep) So who's this guy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Prince Imhotep, High Priest  of Osiris.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, hey, how ya doin'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Connell sticks out his hand, -- Imhotep instantly recoi O'Connell gives him the once-over. Beni quickly covers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Prince does not like to be touched  by other humans. A Silly eastern  superstition, I'm afraid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well, we all got our little  problems today don't we?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He has come to help Mister Burns.  Somehow I feel responsible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't gimme that, you never had any  scruples.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know where I can steal some?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Connell fake-punches him. Beni flinches. O'Connell give Imhotep a look as he strides off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See ya around, Padre.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Imhotep's grotesque new eyes glare out from behind the ma

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The proverbial den-of-iniquity. Hard men, hard women and  hard liquor. Lots of deals going down. An OLDER GUY with walrus mustache is drunk and talking to some tough custom He wears British WWI fighter pilot gear. Meet WINSTON HAV

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm the last of the Royal Force still  stationed here, you know? All the  other laddies died in the air and  were buried in the sand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The tough customers shove him away. Winston staggers over O'Connell and Jonathan at the bar, not missing a beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ever since the end of the Great War,  there hasn't been a single challenge  worthy of a man like me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've heard it before, Winston.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Connell shoves him away. Winston staggers back to Jonat

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just wish I would've chucked it  with the other laddies, gone down in  a flame of glory, instead of sitting  around here, rotting from boredom  and booze!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jonathan shoves him towards another group of unlucky sods Henderson and Daniels sidle up to the bar next to them. Burns, now tongue-less, talks with a severe impediment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The drawer there, spectacles. (tries to laugh) As you see, I won't be needing them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Imhotep opens the drawer and pulls out some bifocals. He  puts the bifocals on over his death mask, -- and grins  broadly, his rotted teeth showing through the mouth hole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mister Burns, Prince Imhotep thanks  you for your spectacles, -- and for  your eyes,... and for your tongue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The expression on Burns' face starts to change, very puzz

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I am afraid more is needed, the  Prince says he must finish the job,  consummate the curse which you and  your friends have brought down upon  yourselves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A look of pure fear registers on Burns, face. Beni quickl backs away and runs out of the room. Imhotep picks up the sacred canopic jar, then removes the death mask, revealin his hideous, shattered CORPSE-SKULL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three shot glasses clink together. O'Connell, Jonathan an Henderson slug 'em down, -- all three of them instantly S OUT the liquid. Half the bar SPITS OUT their drinks as we

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sweet Jesus! That tasted just like,...  like...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all look at each other, even more nervous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "And the rivers and waters of Egypt  went red and were as blood."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A look passes over O'Connell's face, a realization.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He suddenly jumps away from the bar and runs for the door

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's here!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guy! The Priest! THE MUMMY!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LIGHTNING FLASHES as O'Connell races across the compound, knocking several Soldiers out of his way, panic stricken.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evelyn!! EVELYYYYNN!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evelyn calmly steps into a courtyard carrying a handful o books. A BLAST OF THUNDER AND LIGHTNING scares her. She d half the books. Then a HAND GRABS HER! She jumps again an drops the rest of the books. It's O'Connell, breathing ha

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We got problems.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And that's when a barrage of HAIL AND FIRE slams into the courtyard. O'Connell and Evelyn jump back. A water founta bursts into STEAM. A wooden trellis catches FIRE. O'Conne and Evelyn run under the eaves as SOLDIERS, SERVANTS and  CAMELS run in every direction, trying to avoid the maelst

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's here! I saw him! That thing is  here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The creature!? Are you sure!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Connell gives her an incredulous look and gestures at t HAIL and FIRE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pretty sure!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The HAIL and FIRE come to a stop. Everything goes dead qu O'Connell and Evelyn freeze. And then a BLOOD CURDLING SC is heard coming from the living quarters directly above t O'Connell and Evelyn race up the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Connell and Evelyn race into the room, past the Servant who is running out SCREAMING. They skid to a stop as they spot Burns, or what's left of him, lying dead on the floo HIS BODY IS SHRIVELED TO HALF IT'S SIZE. Drained of all organs and liquids. O'Connell and Evelyn a shocked. Then they hear a LOUD MOAN and notice Imhotep  standing on the far side of the room. O'Connell draws his gun. Imhotep is REGENERATING: A thick skin FORMS over powerful new musculature. His tendons RIPPLE. His bones BULGE and  REFORM. His mouth opens to an inhuman size as he MOANS an CRIES OUT, in severe pain. And then it's over. And he loo like an incredibly muscular, corpse-like vision from hell The 'Terminator' Mummy. O'Connell and Evelyn are stunned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are in serious trouble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Imhotep starts to move towards them, staring at Evelyn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back off, creep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Imhotep keeps coming. O'Connell OPENS FIRE. BLASTING Imho Bullets RIP through his body. Imhotep doesn't seem to min Jonathan, Henderson and Daniels run into the room. They'r all stunned at the sight of Imhotep. O'Connell steps forward, throws a RIGHT HOOK, punches Imh in the face, -- HIS FIST GOES THROUGH IMHOTEP'S SKULL AND GETS STUCK DEEP INSIDE HIS HEAD. O'Connell stares at it,  shocked, then quickly YANKS his fist back out. The area o Imhotep's face that came into contact with O'Connell's fi quickly DEGENERATES and DECAYS, right down to the bone, a if O'Connell's hand instantly infected it. Imhotep angrily turns, grabs O'Connell, and with no effor THROWS him across the room and into Jonathan and the othe knocking them down. Imhotep looks at his hand, the one th just grabbed O'Connell, -- IT STARTS TO SHRIVEL and DECAY He quickly turns to Evelyn. Evelyn backs away into a wall terrorized. Imhotep steps up to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You saved me from the undead. For  this, I shall make you immortal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He leans in, about to kiss her with his decayed face. And that's when a WHITE CAT jumps onto the piano, HISSING Imhotep SHRIEKS. The balcony doors BLOW OPEN. Imhotep spi into a BLAST OF WIND AND SAND and SWIRLS out the doors. G O'Connell, Evelyn, Jonathan and Daniels stand transfixed. Henderson kneels next to Burns, shriveled body, horrified

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The curse. The curse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Connell, Jonathan, Henderson and Daniels follow Evelyn  across the Ramesseum.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's only one person I know who  can possibly give us some answers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They round a corner and come upon the Curator, -- who is  talking with Ardeth Ray. Everybody stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: YOU!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Connell and the American's quickly draw their guns. Ard Ray just scowls. The Curator nods his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miss Carnavon. Gentlemen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is he doing here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you truly wish to know? Or would  you prefer to just shoot us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everybody tenses, guns up. Then O'Connell uncocks his .38

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just saw my fist vanish into some  guy's head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He slides his gun back into his shoulder-holster.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm willin, to go on a little faith,  here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You will not believe it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Try me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone is assembled around the tomb display of Seti The First. We recognize his chariot and sword. The Curator sits on S throne.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are part of an ancient secret  society, the cult-of-the-Mumia, and  we have a sacred mission, passed  down through thirty-nine generations.  For over four thousand years we have  guarded The City Of The Dead. we are  sworn at manhood to do any and all  in our power to stop the High Priest  Imhotep from being reborn into this  world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And because of you, we have failed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (appalled) And you think this justifies killing  innocent people!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To have stopped this creature? Yes!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, let's cut to the chase. He's  afraid of cats, what's that about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: According to the ancients, cat's are  the guardians at the gates of the  underworld. Imhotep will fear them  until he is fully regenerated, and  then he will fear nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniels is totally wigged-out, he looks at O'Connell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right! And ya know how he gets fully  regenerated?! By killing everybody  who opened that chest and sucking us  dry! That's how!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, the creature must first try and  regenerate, and then he will attempt  to resurrect the one he has loved  for more than four thousand years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anck-su-namun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Curator and Ardeth Ray look at Evelyn, thunderstruck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the necropolis, when I saw him, - alive,... walking, he called me Anck- su-namun. And then in Mister Burns'  quarters he tried to kiss me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is because it was you who read  from the Book. He has chosen you to  be the human sacrifice needed to  regenerate the body of Anck-su-namun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jonathan scratches his ear with the barrel of his pistol.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is not good. Not good at all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ardeth Ray has been staring out a wall of windows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tonight is the full moon. The moon  of Osiris. It will begin tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone follows Ardeth Ray's eyes, through the windows w can see the SUN, -- which is now going into a FULL ECLIPS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "...and he stretched forth his hands  towards the heavens, and there was  darkness throughout the land of  Egypt."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Connell looks out a window at the British Soldiers mann the walls. Above and beyond them, -- is the BLACK SUN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evelyn and Jonathan are pacing the foyer

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We must stop him from regenerating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns to Daniels and Henderson.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who opened that chest?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, there was me and Daniels here  and then poor Burns of course, oh  yeah, and that Egyptologist fella.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Connell turns from the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about my buddy, Beni?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Naw, he scrammed outta there,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We must find the Egyptologist and  bring him back here to the safety of  the fort, before the creature can  get to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Connell looks at Evelyn, Daniels and Henderson.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay,... Evelyn, you wait here, you  two come with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All three of them pounce on him at once --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hell with that! I'm not goin'  nowhere! We're safe here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I'm not leavin, this fort for  nothin'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who put you in charge? You can't  just leave me behind like some old  suitcase. I'm the one responsible  for this mess and I intend to be the  one to clean it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Connell just shakes his head and SIGHS. Totally put-upo Then he takes Evelyn, shoves her into the bedroom, slams door and locks it with a skeleton key. From inside her ro we can hear Evelyn POUNDING on the door and YELLING. O'Connell throws the skeleton key to Daniels.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep an eye on her. If you leave her  door, I'll rip your spleen out. C'mon,  Jonathan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jonathan swallows hard and points to himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me?

dialogues.speaker: CAIRO ALLEYWAYS
dialogues.text: The Egyptologist stumbles through the dark alleys, lookin haunted. He clutches the Book of The Dead in one hand and his SACRED CANOPIC JAR in the other. Imhotep is stalking  him. A STREET VENDOR turns and sees Imhotep's horribly de face. He reacts and scurries away. Imhotep lifts his robe, cove his face, and moves in on the Egyptologist, who is headin into the bazaar. WE PAN UP TO --

dialogues.speaker: THE EGYPTOLOGIST'S OFFICE
dialogues.text: Beni is RANSACKING the joint, pulling out drawers and fil and throwing them on the floor. He finds a silver pocket  watch, shakes it, then throws it into his pocket, then he starts tipping over bookcases and clearing shelves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, well, well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beni spins around. O'Connell and Jonathan stand in the do

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lemme guess, spring cleaning?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beni turns and runs for an open window. O'Connell grabs a chair, FLINGS IT into his path. Beni TRIPS and CRASHES in a wall. O'Connell strides over, grabs him and lifts him u the wall. Beni's feet dangle off the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's your new friend?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What friend? You're my only friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Connell quickly slides his knife up under Beni's chin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then you got no excuse for living.  What the hell you doin, being buddies  with this creep, Beni? What's in it  for you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is better to be the right hand of  the Devil,... than in his path. As  long as I serve him, I am immune.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Immune from what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You shall see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you looking for? Lie, and  I'll slit your throat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Connell shoves the knife deeper into Beni's skin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The book! The black book they found  at Hamunaptra! Imhotep wants it back.  Said to me it would be worth it's  weight in diamonds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What does he want the book for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shrugs) Something about bringing his dead  girly-friend back to life. He needs  the book... (looks at Jonathan) And your sister.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Connell looks at Jonathan. Beni seizes the moment and K O'Connell in the balls. O'Connell doubles over and collap Beni leaps out the window. Jonathan cringes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That looked rather painful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (wincing) Ya know, ever since I met you, my  luck has been for crap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I know, I do that to people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And that's when they hear a BLOOD CURDLING SCREAM coming  from down in the bazaar. O'Connell and Jonathan scramble the window and look out --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Down in the bazaar, people are SCREAMING and quickly back away from the SHRIVELED CORPSE OF THE EGYPTOLOGIST. A partially decayed HAND reaches down and takes the sacre canopic jar out of the Egyptologist's shriveled hand. It' Imhotep, having regenerated even further. He looks up and catches eyes with O'Connell. Imhotep grins, then UNHINGES his jaw, his mouth stretches to an inhuman size, and then huge SWARM OF FLIES comes out of his mouth and races stra up at O'Connell and Jonathan. They both SLAM the shutters The flies SLAM into the closed window and immediately spr throughout the bazaar. Sending people SCREAMING and runni

dialogues.speaker: EGYPTOLOGIST'S OFFICE
dialogues.text: O'Connell and Jonathan look at each other, panicked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn-it! That's two down and only  two to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then he'll be coming after Evy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They turn and race out of the office.

dialogues.speaker: BRITISH FORT
dialogues.text: Daniels stares out a window, watching the British Guards the front gate. More Soldiers march the encircling parape

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ten o'clock! All is well!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lights and MUSIC from the Casbah come up from below

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniels turns from the window. Henderson sits in a chair  next to Evelyn's door, chain smoking. Both look wired wit fear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hell with this. I'm goin,  downstairs to get me a drink. You  want somethin'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, get me a glass of bourbon, a  shot of bourbon and a bourbon chaser.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniels nods and heads out. Henderson just sits there, al smoking. He reaches into his jacket pocket, pulls out his SACRED CANOPIC JAR and fondles it. A BREEZE suddenly come in through the open window. The curtains flutter. Henders gets up and goes over to shut it. He looks out the window The CAMERA races over the compound, into the window and H Henderson square in the FACE just as he's about to scream Henderson is lifted into the air by a mass of SWIRLING SA His body TWISTS and TURNS and slowly SHRIVELS as the life SUCKED out of him. Then he COLLAPSES to the floor. On the wall above him, th SHADOW of the SWIRLING SAND condenses, forming a SHADOW o human body. The SHADOW CONVULSES as the body REGENERATES. And then it's over. Imhotep steps into view. He's regenerated even further an looks almost normal now, his face no longer decayed. He s over Henderson's shriveled body and up to Evelyn's door,  rattles the knob. It's locked. Imhotep grins.

dialogues.speaker: EVELYN'S ROOM
dialogues.text: Evelyn is asleep in her bed as SAND begins streaming in  through the keyhole, pouring onto the floor, forming a la mound. Evelyn starts to toss and turn. WE PAN BACK OVER T THE DOOR: The mound of sand is gone and in it's place is  Imhotep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Connell and Jonathan race into the foyer and skid to a  stop as they see Henderson's shriveled body on the floor. O'Connell runs up to Evelyn's door and rattles the knob,  still locked. He bends down and looks in through the KEYH

dialogues.speaker: EVELYN'S ROOM
dialogues.text: Imhotep leans down towards Evelyn, about to kiss her as s sleeps. The door starts to CRASH and BANG from O'Connell. Imhotep ignores it. And KISSES Evelyn. His lips and mouth instantly start to DEGENERATE and DECAY. Right down to th bone. The door BURSTS OPEN. Evelyn wakes up. Sees Imhotep rotted mouth kissing her. She SCREAMS and shoves him away Imhotep's putrid mouth grimaces in sadness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get your hands off my girl, pal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Imhotep's sadness turns to anger as he spins around and f O'Connell. Imhotep licks his fetid lips. O'Connell smirks

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice lips.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Imhotep starts to move for O'Connell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I figured you might be here, so I  brought a friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He throws the white cat at Imhotep. Imhotep instinctively catches it. He SHRIEKS, drops the cat and stumbles back towards the  window, -- which suddenly BLOWS OPEN. Imhotep spins like dervish and BURSTS INTO A WHIRLWIND OF SAND. Everybody covers their eyes. The Imhotep/sand-devil EXPLO out the window and vanishes over the compound. Jonathan aims his gun at the window, his hand shaking bad O'Connell hugs Evelyn as she wipes her mouth in disgust. Daniels walks in, looks at Henderson's shriveled body on floor... and drops the martini glasses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jonathan races his big convertible through the streets,  HONKING constantly. Evelyn sits between him and O'Connell looking scared and nervous, then she gives O'Connell a lo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You called me your girl?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?... Oh yeah, that was just um,  you know, figure a speech.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think you were jealous

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jealous? You kiddin' me? Did you see  that guy's face?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniels leans forward from the back seat, filled with fea

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut-up! JUST SHUT-UP! We gotta do  somethin'! we gotta do somethin,  NOW! Before it's too late!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They race into the driveway of the museum of Antiquities.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A FULL MOON now shines down on the bazaar, still bustling with activity. Suddenly, a BREEZE kicks-in. GREEN MIST be to SWIRL down the street and through the stalls. The peop begin to CHOKE and COUGH and RETCH, as if being hit by a  severe sickness -- it's already too late. Imhotep strolls through the sickened mob, his face half r off, his deformed mouth grinning happily. Beni is at his  side, looking very nervous. And then, one-by-one, the people silently begin to follow Imhotep, their skin now covered in disgustingly hideous B AND SORES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Connell., Jonathan, Daniels, the Curator and Ardeth Ray follow Evelyn as she strides through the museum.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Last month I came across an  inscription that mentioned The Book  Of The Dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That book we found at Hamunaptra?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. I dismissed it, because it talked  about bringing people back from the  dead. A notion I was unwilling to  believe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Believe it, sister. That's what  brought our buddy back to life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And now he's going to use it to bring  his girlfriend back

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And if he succeeds, the two of them  together will bring about the  apocalypse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Curator joins Evelyn at her side as she heads up the  stairs, everyone else in hot pursuit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The plagues we have seen so far, are  merely Imhotep flexing his muscles.  Only at the moment of Anck-su-namun's  resurrection will he be truly  invincible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They reach the display cases. Evelyn quickly opens them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm thinking that if the black Book  Of The Dead can bring people back to  life --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- then perhaps, the golden Book Of  The Living can return them to the  underworld.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactly --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So your sayin', if we find the book  made outta gold --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- And read the sacred incantations  contained inside it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think it'll send this guy back  to hell?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Correct, And that's when --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LOUD CHANTING is heard coming from outside. They all rush over to the upper windows and look down -- OUTSIDE: A lar CRAZED MOB covered in hideous boils and sores comes CHANT up the driveway: 'Anck-su-namun! Anck-su-namun!'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It has begun. The beginning of the  end.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not quite yet it hasn't. C'mon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evelyn dashes back to the display cases. Everyone follows

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crazed mob CRASHES into the huge front doors, which a locked. They pound furiously, throwing themselves at it w CHANTING CONSTANTLY. Imhotep solemnly comes up the drivew

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The BANGING on the doors can be heard as Evelyn and the  Curator quickly sort through broken pieces of stone table The others watch. Evelyn pulls out a large piece.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The BANGING gets LOUDER. Multiple windows SHATTER. Evelyn talks while quickly translating the tablet:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Since the black Book of The Dead was  found inside the statue of Anubis,  then according to this, the golden  Book of The Living should be inside...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evelyn finds the translation in the tablet and smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHAT!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The golden Book Of The Living, is  inside the statue of Horus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which would be located not far to  the east of the Anubis statue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't tell me we gotta go back out  there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If we want to kill the creature,  yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWO HIDEOUS BOIL & SORE-COVERED MEN charge out of a d SCREAMING. O'Connell and Ardeth Ray grab them and chuck t over the railing. The men fly through the air and CRASH i the lower display cases. The front doors suddenly BURST O The crazed mob pours into the museum. our heroes haul ass across the balcony and down the staircase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jonathan sneaks out of some bushes and quickly heads for convertible. Suddenly, a splinter group of the diseased m comes around the side of the museum. Jonathan instantly b his eyes out, starts drooling, and begins CHANTING --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anck-su-namun! Anck-su-namun!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crazed group runs past him and heads into the front d of the museum. Jonathan leaps into the convertible, fires up and 180's it back over to the bushes. O'Connell, Evelyn, Daniels, Ardeth Ray and the Curator ju inside the car. Beni steps out of the museum and sees the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Imhotep! IMHOTEP!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Imhotep looks out of the museum from the shattered upper  windows just as the convertible PEELS OUT. O'Connell poin a finger at Beni as they race past him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're gonna get yours, pal!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Imhotep UNHINGES his jaw, his mouth stretches to an inhum size, he lets out one of his horrific, primordial SHRIEKS His disease-ridden disciples immediately begin pouring ou of the front doors of the museum and chasing after the ca

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The convertible hauls ass down the narrow bazaar street. Crazies start jumping out of stalls and LEAPING onto the  car. O'Connell and the others fight them off, throwing th overboard. More people JUMP on. Jonathan SWERVES the car, CRASHES through some stalls, knocking them off, but not b they manage to open the back door and YANK Daniels out. H TUMBLES across the pavement. Gets up SHOOTING. Backs into corner, FIRING his pistol into the hideous rabble, killin several, keeping them at bay. His gun goes empty, CLICK!  CLICK! CLICK! But the mob stays back, looking at him like rabid vultures. Daniels eyes them, filled with fear. The mob parts like the red sea as Imhotep walks through t and up to Daniels. Daniels whimpers in fear, tears pour d his cheeks. Then he gets an idea, reaches into his pocket and pulls out his jewel encrusted SACRED CANOPIC JAR. He  holds it out for Imhotep. Imhotep takes it and grins. Thr his tears, Daniels grins back, hopeful that he'll be spar WE CUT WIDE: Somewhere in the middle of the crazed, disea mob, we hear Daniels give out A BLOOD CURDLING SCREAM...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The convertible slowly motors down the narrow alleys. WE  DOLLY across the hood of the car from Jonathan to Evelyn O'Connell. Ardeth Ray and the Curator are still in the ba All of them staring out the front windshield. Freaked-out Then suddenly one of the hideous ghouls CRASHES through t windshield! Everybody SCREAMS. Jonathan hits the gas, los control, the car SLAMS into a wall. O'Connell grabs Evely

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon! C'mon! Let's go! Let's go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all leap out of the car. But the angry, festering mo quickly surrounds them. O'Connell quickly reaches into hi gunny-sack, pulls out a stick of dynamite, then reaches i his pocket and pulls out a match. He looks around for a w to light it, then reaches over and strikes it across Arde Ray's stubbly face. Ardeth Ray YELPS. O'Connell holds the lit match near the fuse. The crazed, CHANTING mob gives O'Connell a wide berth, st at him and the others with insane, bloodshot eyes. And then Imhotep steps through, -- having fully regenerat he now looks as young and handsome and muscular as he did the day he was buried alive. Evelyn stares at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's gorgeous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Connell gives her a look, the match burns his fingers. YELPS and throws it down, grabs another match and strikes across Ardeth Ray's face again. Ardeth Ray YELPS and give O'Connell a look to kill. The Curator shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He has consummated the curse, now  all he need do is raise Anck-su-namun  from the dead, then it will be the  end of us, and the beginning for  them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Imhotep moves forward, heading right for them. O'Connell  LIGHTS THE FUSE. Imhotep steps up to O'Connell and stops, watching the fuse burn down. it's a game of chicken. The  tension mounts. The LIT FUSE is about to vanish inside th stick of dynamite, blowing it up, -- when Evelyn leans fo and blows it out. O'Connell exhales, but keeps his eyes o Imhotep, who extends his hand to Evelyn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Koontash dai na.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beni steps through the swarming mass, translating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
