dialogues.text: Take his hand and he will spare the  others.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evelyn hesitates, looks around at the huge, bloodthirsty  crowd surrounding them, holding axes, picks and scimitars waiting to pounce, then she looks at Imhotep, confident,  powerful, invincible. Then she looks at O'Connell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any bright ideas?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Connell talks through angry, grit teeth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, fresh out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evelyn looks back at Imhotep, then starts to reach out to take his hand. Both O'Connell and Jonathan move to stop h but Ardeth Ray grabs them both and holds them tight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't do it, Evelyn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have no choice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evelyn's trembling hand touches Imhotep's: His hand close around hers. Nothing happens. Imhotep smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keetah mi pharos, aja nilo, isirlan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come with me my princess. It is time  to make you mine, forever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evelyn gives Beni a nasty look, correcting him --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All eternity, idiot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then she looks at O'Connell and puts on her best face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You better think of something, because  if he turns me into a mummy, you're  the first one I'm coming after.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Connell almost smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got guts, lady.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I know, and I'd like to keep  them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Imhotep suddenly notices something. He reaches forward an RIPS THE KEY/BOX OUT OF JONATHAN'S UPPER JACKET POCKET.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey that's mine -- !

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ardeth Ray holds Jonathan back. Imhotep pulls Evelyn away O'Connell can't take it anymore, he tries to break free o Ardeth Ray's grip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evelyn!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The huge, powerful man holds him tight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be calm. There is still time. We can  stop him yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crowd parts for Imhotep and Evelyn. And then Imhotep  stops and looks back at O'Connell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pared oos.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evelyn SCREAMS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NOOO!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beni smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kill them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Imhotep pulls her away. O'Connell breaks free of Ardeth R grip and stumbles forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EVELYN!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But the rabid vultures are already moving in for the kill O'Connell quickly bends down, pulls open a CISTERN/MANHOL COVER and shoves Jonathan down inside it, then jumps in a him. The Curator pushes Ardeth Ray towards the cistern ho

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go! Find a way! Kill the creature!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Curator turns and throws himself at the mob as Ardeth Ray crawls down into the hole. The mob tears the Curator  apart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Connell, Jonathan and Ardeth Ray slosh their way down t watery catacomb, crazies pouring in behind them. Up ahead LIGHT suddenly shines in from another cistern hole, and t more of the infected crowd drop down, SCREECHING like rat O'Connell jags right, pushing Jonathan and Ardeth Ray ahe of him, he strikes a match off the wall, lights the nubby fuse on a stick of dynamite, throws it, and runs like hel FIRE BLAST incinerates a bunch of crazies.

dialogues.speaker: STREET
dialogues.text: The EXPLOSION blows a cistern cover fifty feet into the a followed by a mass of FLAMMAGE...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A sewer grate is kicked out of a wall. O'Connell, Jonatha and Ardeth Ray climb out of the hole and into AN ALLEY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We gotta get her back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm with you, old man. No one touches  my sister like that and gets away  with it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Connell looks at Ardeth Ray.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know where he's taking her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. To Hamunaptra. To perform the  ritual.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jonathan looks worried.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what ritual would that be?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ritual to bring the body of Anck- su-namun back to life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And how does one do that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By reading the Book Of The Dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yes, of course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then killing your sister.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ardeth Ray looks at O'Connell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Imhotep is now able to cross the  desert with great haste.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jonathan taps him in the shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Begging your pardon, but I wasn't  quite clear on that last part.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ardeth Ray ignores him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If he arrives before us, it will be  too late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you say 'kill' my sister?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Connell smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know how to beat him to it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And on that WE SMASH CUT TO -- THE ERFOUD DUNES - DAWN  Jonathan's bashed-in convertible steams it's way up to a of semi-abandoned Quonset huts. A single WWI BIPLANE with R.A.F. INSIGNIAS sits in the sand beside them. A SIGN REA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Connell, Jonathan and Ardeth Ray stand before Winston  Havlock, the massive dunes of Erfoud as our background.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what's your little problem got to  do with His Majesty's Royal Air Corp?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not a god-damned thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Winston looks intrigued.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it dangerous?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You probably won't live through it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This really interests him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By Jove, do you really think so?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everybody else we've bumped into has  died, why not you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Winston nods his head, he's hooked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what's the challenge then?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To save the damsel in distress, kill  the bad guy and steal his treasure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A slow grin spreads across Winston's face, then he gives  them a snappy salute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Winston Havlock at your service,  sir!

dialogues.speaker: SAHARA
dialogues.text: Way off across the desert, a large SAND-DEVIL races over dunes. The SANDY WHIRLWIND comes to a stop and starts to  dissipate. Evelyn and Beni are suddenly ejected out of it they land in a dune. The SWIRLING SAND CONDENSES AND FORM INTO IMHOTEP. He looks up into the sky, listening careful Evelyn shakes the sand out of her hair and looks at Beni.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What just happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All I remember is him turning into a  blast of sand,... and then I remember  nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then they hear a plane in the sky and look up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The WIND whips at Winston in the cockpit. O'Connell sits the gunner's compartment. Jonathan is strapped spread-eag across the left wing, Ardeth Ray is tied tight to the rig Both men are scared out of their wits and SCREAMING in fe

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Imhotep's jaw UNHINGES, his mouth opens to an inhuman siz he lets fly with another one of his horrible SHRIEKS. -- a massive WALL OF SAND rises up out of the desert

dialogues.speaker: BIPLANE
dialogues.text: O'Connell watches the desert below him come alive and ris up towards the plane. Winston looks over the side and see what's coming. He laughs, throws the throttle, and puts t plane into a dive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hang on, men!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WE GO WIDE AS: The sandstorm chases the diving, twisting  biplane. Getting closer and closer, about to engulf it. O'Connell looks back into the blinding sand and sees a GI FACE forming inside the sandstorm. It's Imhotep. Grinning O'Connell grabs the Lewis machine-gun, cocks the bracket FIRES, blasting away at Imhotep's giant face inside the  sandstorm. Imhotep's face begins to laugh, then his jaw  unhinges, his mouth opens wide, and he ENGULFS the plane. Winston blindly fights for control, elated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're going down!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The biplane SPINS inside the BLOWING SAND. Engines ROARIN Wind HOWLING. Jonathan and Ardeth Ray SCREAMING. Winston  Havlock LAUGHING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here I come, laddies!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Connell braces himself for impact,

dialogues.speaker: SAHARA
dialogues.text: Evelyn leaps to her feet and runs over to Imhotep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop it! You'll kill them!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Imhotep grabs her, pulls her close, her beautiful eyes st into his shockingly intense ones. Then he kisses her, har Evelyn's eyes widen, stunned and mesmerized, then she pus herself away and falls back into the sand. Imhotep laughs

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The biplane SMASHES over a dune, ROLLS OVER and CRASHES u down into another dune. The SAND SWIRLS as O'Connell fall out of the gunner's compartment. The left wing is jammed  into the dune, Jonathan hangs upside down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me... A little help would be  useful... IF IT'S NOT TOO MUCH  TROUBLE!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Connell goes to help Jonathan. Ardeth Ray stumbles over the gunner's compartment and tears the Lewis gun off it's mount. He throws the machine-gun over one shoulder, a  cartridge belt over the other and staggers away. O'Connel and Jonathan look into the cockpit. Winston Havlock is de A smile on his face. The plane suddenly starts to move, t sand sinks under their feet, they quickly high-tail-it aw O'Connell, Jonathan and Ardeth Ray make it to some rocks look back. The biplane, with Winston Havlock inside, slid away over a dune. O'Connell gives it a salute. The plane  vanishes over the dune and into the SWIRLING SAND...

dialogues.speaker: HAMUNAPTRA
dialogues.text: O'Connell, Jonathan and Ardeth Ray come down a ravine in volcano and look out over the ruins of Hamunaptra.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, now what the hell does this  Horus guy look like?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's a big fellow with pointy ears  and a face like a falcon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got it.

dialogues.speaker: HAMUNAPTRA STAIRWAY
dialogues.text: Carrying TORCHES, O'Connell, Jonathan and Ardeth Ray make their way down a long, winding, narrow staircase. Heading into the bowels of the necropolis. A passageway to hell.

dialogues.speaker: NECROPOLIS
dialogues.text: Evelyn follows Imhotep into the underground cemetery. She stops at the sight of all the big hairy rats scurrying th the mausoleums and over the gravestones. Beni shoves his  rifle into her back and pushes her forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep moving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evelyn gives him a look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, nasty little fellows such  as yourself, always get their  comeuppance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beni suddenly looks worried.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yes, always.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beni looks even more worried, he nervously starts chewing his lip. All three of them walk over the bridge crossing disgusting DETRITUS MOAT. Evelyn looks down at it, horrif

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Connell and Ardeth Ray are busy digging out a collapsed doorway. Jonathan notices an AMETHYST SCARAB on the far w

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I say, look at that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He walks over and tries to jiggle it free. It comes loose his hand. He looks at the scarab in his palm. It starts t glow. And then something inside it starts to WIGGLE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say, gents! You should come have a  look at this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The wiggling continues; a long, agonizing BEAT, and then scarab breaks out of it's cocoon and instantly BURROWS in Jonathan's palm. Jonathan starts to freak out and SCREAM. O'Connell runs up and rips the arm off Jonathan's shirt. scarab is now BURROWING UP JONATHAN'S ARM. O'Connell whip out his butterfly-knife, snaps it open and grabs Jonathan arm. Jonathan's eyes widen in terror as the knife passes front of his face. Jonathan SCREAMS LOUDER, obviously bei cut open. O'Connell's hand flicks something away. The scarab hits the floor and immediately starts scurryin back towards Jonathan, wanting to finish the job. O'Connell pulls out his gun and blows it away, -- BLAM!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The GUNSHOT echoes into the cemetery as Imhotep, Evelyn a Beni step-up to the strange ALTAR, where four thousand ye ago Imhotep tried to bring Anck-su-namun back to life. Imhotep scowls at the sound and angrily reaches into a CA JAR. He pulls out the crusted remains of Anck-su-namun's  heart, crushes it to dust in his hand and starts reading  from The Book Of The Dead. Then he BLOWS the dust against mausoleum wall, -- THE WALL STARTS TO COME ALIVE. Evelyn and Beni stare at the wall, both of them wide-eyed TWO FORMS emerge from the mausoleum's wall. Horrific-look mummified CORPSES. Two of Imhotep's long dead Priests. They bow to Imhotep, then turn and move off down a passag

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Connell helps Ardeth Ray mend Jonathan's wound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From now on, don't touch anything.  Not a damn thing. Keep your hands  off the furniture, got it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jonathan swallows hard and nods vigorously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Imhotep prepares the altar while speaking in HEBREW. Beni holds his gun on her, translating:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Prince Imhotep wants your heart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evelyn blushes, feeling complimented by the handsome prin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell him, I'm truly flattered... but  that it's already taken.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Imhotep continues SPEAKING while laying the four jewel  encrusted canopic jars next to the shattered one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He wants your heart and your brain,  your liver, your kidneys...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evelyn's eyes widen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and how do you say? Those slimy  things, in your stomach?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Intestines.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah! Them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evelyn can't believe it, she furiously turns to Imhotep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You only want me for my organs?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Imhotep looks at her and grins, then BACKHANDS her -- WAP Evelyn goes down for the count. Imhotep stares at her, co malevolent, then he turns and walks off into the mausoleu Beni nervously glances around, then quickly scurries away

dialogues.speaker: TREASURE CHAMBER
dialogues.text: O'Connell squeezes through a small crevice in a wall and  drops to the floor of a dark chamber. He picks up his  gunnysack and scans the darkness. Something GLITTERS. Jon and Ardeth Ray crawl in behind him. O'Connell notices a SHAFT OF LIGHT, high above him, shoot through a small hole in the ceiling and stopping against wall next to one of those mirror disks. O'Connell aims hi gun. FIRES. The bullet STRIKES the disk's pedestal, spinn the mirror into the shaft of light, -- And WHAM! THE SHAF

dialogues.speaker: FROM ONE DISK TO ANOTHER UNTIL THE WHOLE CHAMBER IS LIT U
dialogues.text: It's an enormous TREASURE CHAMBER. Filled to overflowing. Everything sparkles and shines. The wealth of Egypt. O'Connell, Jonathan and Ardeth Ray are speechless. That's when the two mummified Priest-mummies walk in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who the hell are these guys?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Priests. Imhotep's priests.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Connell pulls the elephant gun out of his gunny-sack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never killed a priest before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are evil, cursed, they matter  not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, okay then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Connell FIRES the elephant gun. SMOKE and FLAME shoot o BLASTS one of the mummies. Blows it's upper torso clean o O'Connell pumps the gun, the huge spent cartridge flips  through the air. He FIRES again. BLASTS the other mummy,  blows this one's torso clean off as well. The smoke clear The two sets of LEGS keep walking forward, unaffected by loss of their upper torsos. O'Connell can't believe it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh come on, gimme a break here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then the disemboweled upper torsos start to move, tur over and crawling towards our heroes, who start to back a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Imhotep turns from the altar as he hears more GUNSHOTS ec out of the passageways. He angrily reaches into another o Anck-su-namun's canopic jars, pulls out her crusty liver crushes it to dust, then quickly starts reading a passage from the Book and BLOWS the dust down a passageway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ancient Egyptian --  subtitled) Kill them! Kill them all! And bring  me the Book Of The Living!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A dusty BREEZE blows into the chamber as O'Connell, Jonat and Ardeth Ray back away from the mummy pieces. The floor where they were just standing suddenly STARTS TO MOVE. Tw more mummies slowly dig their way up out of the floor. Mo mummies start coming out of the walls and crawling out of the piles of gold. All the mummies head for our heroes. O'Connell lifts the elephant gun. Ardeth Ray stops him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My turn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ardeth Ray OPENS UP with the Lewis gun. BLASTING the shit out of the mummies. They keep on coming. Even more now. O'Connell OPENS FIRE with the elephant gun, pumping and F as all three of the men back away and haul ass. The mummi and mummy pieces follow them into the passageway. Then Beni creeps into the chamber. He stares in wonder at all the treasure. Then falls backwards into a pile of jew and rolls about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evelyn wakes up, lying chained to the top of the altar. S blinks, then turns her head, -- and looks right into the  ROTTED FACE of Anck-su-namun's corpse. Evelyn SCREAMS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The elephant gun FIRES, blasting FLAME and SMOKE right in the LENS. O'Connell, Jonathan and Ardeth Ray race down a  passageway, a dozen mummies striding after them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This whole place is comin, alive!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The men race around a corner. More mummies. They race aro another corner. More mummies. Onward they come. Methodica Relentless. Boxing in our heroes. O'Connell and Ardeth Ra FIRING as they go. Ardeth Ray goes empty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He throws the machine-gun down and they all race into --

dialogues.speaker: HORUS' CHAMBER
dialogues.text: -- A small chamber. The lower half of the giant statue of HORUS stands in the middle of the chamber.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There he is!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They run up to the base of the statue,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello Horus old boy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Connell looks back at the mummies coming down the  passageway. He reaches into his gunny-sack and pulls out stick of dynamite. Ardeth Ray taps him on the shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Allow me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Connell hands him the dynamite and a match, then turns look at the statue. Ardeth Ray reaches forward and strike the match off O'Connell's stubbly face. O'Connell YELPS. Ardeth Ray lights the dynamite and throws it down the  passageway. They all hit the deck. The dynamite EXPLODES. Ripping apart the creatures, causing a CAVE-IN and sealin the passageway with rock and dirt. Now there's only one w out, -- another dark, creepy passageway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chained tight to the top of the altar, Evelyn hopelessly  struggles to free herself. She stops as Priest mummies st surrounding the altar. Evelyn is horrified as the hideous mummies kneel down and begin to CHANT, -- which now sound even more horrific due to the lack of tongues, jaws and m in the room. Imhotep steps up carrying the black Book Of The Dead. His hand reaches out and lovingly caresses Anck-su-namun's de cheek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Connell and Jonathan are digging away at the seams of t secret compartment, it starts to give. And that's when Ar Ray spots another group of rotting mummies coming down th dark passageway, heading right for them. O'Connell looks

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These guys just don't quit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ardeth Ray grabs the elephant gun and a handful of shells and runs off towards the mummies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep digging!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Connell and Jonathan redouble their efforts, pulling ha on the seam. The compartment starts to loosen. About to g The last time this happened, salt acid sprayed out, remem Our heroes keep tugging. The tension mounts... And that's when a SKELETAL HAND BURSTS UP OUT OF THE GROU and grabs O'Connell's ankle. Several more moldy hands BUR up out of the ground. O'Connell and Jonathan struggle wit the mummies as they crawl up out of the dirt floor. One of the mummies violently shoves O'Connell away. Anoth grabs Jonathan by the throat and starts to strangle him. third mummy grabs at the secret compartment and pulls har

dialogues.speaker: AN INTENSE BURST OF ACID SPRAYS OUT OF THE SEAM AND HITS
dialogues.text: THREE OF THE MUMMIES. The one strangling Jonathan gets it the back and drops him. All three mummies melt horribly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Imhotep begins to read from The Book Of The Dead. A large SWIRLING HOLE starts to open in the detritus bog. Evelyn's eyes widen in amazement and horror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ardeth Ray BLASTS AWAY at the oncoming mummies. over at t base of the statue, O'Connell and Jonathan pull an ornate chest out of the secret compartment. O'Connell rips off t lid, reaches inside and pulls out a heavy burlap bag. He and Jonathan exchange nervous, excited looks. Then he  reaches into the bag and slowly pulls out the SOLID GOLD  Book Of The Living -- GOLDEN LIGHT reflects off their fac as they stare at it in wonder. The elephant gun goes empty. Ardeth Ray takes it by the b and wades into the remaining mummies swinging.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Save the girl! Kill the creature!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The mummies quickly overwhelm and start to tear him apart O'Connell lights the last stick of dynamite and throws it against the far wall. He and Jonathan hit the deck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the last one, we better get  lucky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The wall BLOWS. Debris COLLAPSES, -- but now here's a hol for them to get out. O'Connell and Jonathan race out thro the hole just as the remaining mummies enter the chamber.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Outside, Beni staggers across the sand with a saddlebag f with treasure. He throws it over the rear of a camel. Starts to climb up. Hesitates. Looks back at the temple d Licks his lips. And then his greed gets the better of him and he quickly climbs down and scurries back towards the  door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Imhotep READS from the Book. The rotten Priest-mummies ro back and forth, CHANTING. Evelyn struggles. Then suddenly, the strange MIST wafts up out of the swirl hole and over to the sacred jars, it passes through them into Evelyn. Evelyn JERKS as though she's been electrifie The MIST passes through her and into Anck-su-namun's body The CHANTING PRIESTS, SWIRLING HOLE, WAFTING MIST and  IMHOTEP'S READINGS reach a crescendo. Anck-su-namun's cru EYELIDS suddenly POP OPEN. Evelyn stares at her in disbel Anck-su-namun's rotted head turns and looks at Evelyn wit empty sockets. Evelyn freaks out and struggles wildly, th she notices Imhotep holding the ancient sacrificial knife

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With your death, my love and I will  be invincible!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He raises it up over Evelyn's chest, about to plunge it d Evelyn's eyes widen in horror. And that's when O'Connell Jonathan BURST IN. Imhotep spins around and faces them. Jonathan beams as he holds up the golden Book Of The Livi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I found it, Evy! I found it

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut-up and get me off of here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Connell grabs an ancient sword out of a statue's hand,  jumps up onto a gravestone and leaps out over the Priests The Priest-mummies stop chanting. The MIST vanishes. Imhotep steps forward. O'Connell STRIKES the sacrificial  knife out of his hand. Imhotep BELLOWS a command. The Pri stand up, swords and knives in hand, they ATTACK O'Connel

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Open the book, Jonathan! Open the  book! That's the only way to kill  him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Connell RACKS and CHOPS at the attacking Priest-mummies fighting his way to Evelyn. The skeletal creatures wildly SWING their swords, trying to STAB O'Connell. Jonathan fu with the book, struggling to open it, -- he can't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't open it! It's locked or  something!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Connell CUTS two of the mummies in half, then swings hi sword down at Evelyn, -- CLANG! One chain breaks free. Jonathan spots a series of SOLID GOLD, FOUR-SIDED LOCKS a the binder. It hits him like lightning --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need the key!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Imhotep grins, then grabs the KEY/BOX hanging from a chai around his neck, rips it off and shoves it into his pocke He picks up the sacrificial sword and heads for Jonathan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do I do, Evy!? What do I do!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Read the inscription on the cover!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Connell swings his sword down again, -- CLANG! Evelyn n has one hand and one leg free. More mummies attack O'Conn force him back. Jonathan quickly starts translating the cover inscription but his ancient Egyptian is clearly awful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keetash-something, naraba-something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jonathan starts to backpedal through the cemetery, clutch the golden book; wide-eyed, as Imhotep moves in on him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ebarra im hatu Kashka ummmmm -- ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jonathan trips and falls on his ass. Imhotep CHARGES FORW O'Connell SLASHES another chain. Only one more left holdi Evelyn. Jonathan sits up and quickly looks back at the co

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rasheem Aaaaa ANUBIS!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Imhotep raises the sacrificial sword, about to kill Jonat And that's when the giant statue of Anubis suddenly CRASH through the wall -- shades of Ray Harryhausen. Only bette The god of Deaths, horrible, decrepit STONE FACE stares  angrily down. Jonathan stares back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh boy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Connell DECAPITATES a mummy and looks up at Anubis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This just keeps gettin, better and  better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Imhotep leaves Jonathan and heads for the giant statue. O'Connell leaps over and with one last swing of the sword frees Evelyn from her chains. More Priest-mummies attack, forcing him away. Evelyn jumps off the altar and starts t head for O'Connell, -- a SKELETAL HAND grabs her! Spins h around. It's Anck-su-namun's rotted corpse. Evelyn reacts Imhotep looks up at Anubis, points to O'Connell, and in  ANCIENT EGYPTIAN commands him to attack. Anubis moves for O'Connell, STOMPING over mausoleums and through the detri moat on his way. O'Connell quickly backs away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do something, Jonathan! Kill it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have got to be joking?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evelyn is backing away from Anck-su-namun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finish the inscription, idiot!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anck-su-namun ATTACKS Evelyn. Evelyn fends her off as bes she can. Jonathan quickly looks back at the hieroglyphs o the book cover, fumbling badly under the pressure --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ummm, Hootash im... Hootash im now  what is this last symbol here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's it look like!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anck-su-namun grabs Evelyn by the throat. The statue of A corners O'Connell, reaches down and GRABS him with it's  MASSIVE TALONS. O'Connell HACKS away at it. Jonathan star at the inscription, slightly oblivious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's an Anck symbol, with two little  squiggly lines above it, and a bird,  a stork! on either side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evelyn is being STRANGLED by Anck-su-namun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah! Ah! Ahmenophus!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes,... I see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The talons lift O'Connell up and start to CRUSH him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hootash im Ahmenophus!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The giant statue of Anubis instantly freezes in it's trac and PETRIFIES. It's off balance. Starts to fall. O'Connel slides free of it's talons. Evelyn SHOVES Anck-su-namun a Anck-su-namun looks up and opens her fetid mouth to screa just as Anubis CRASHES DOWN on top of her, SMASHING HER t powder and DRIVING her into the ground. Imhotep SHRIEKS in rage and horror, then turns and angril heads for Jonathan. Jonathan, sitting on his ass, quickly backpedals on his hands and heels. O'Connell leaps to his feet, sword in hand and runs for  Imhotep. Imhotep grabs Jonathan, lifts him up, rips the g Book Of The Living out of his hand and pins him to a wall O'Connell runs up and swings his sword at Imhotep, -- WAP SLICES Imhotep's right arm off. It drops to the ground, s clutching The Book Of The Living. Imhotep drops Jonathan spins around, facing O'Connell. O'Connell grins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay pal, let's see how tough you  are without your right arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Imhotep grabs O'Connell with his left arm and THROWS him  half way across the cemetery. O'Connell SLAMS into a  gravestone, bounces off and crashes to the ground. He sha it off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright,... so he's left handed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Imhotep is already striding towards him. Jonathan lifts u his hand, -- HE HAS THE KEY/BOX BACK! He smiles at Evelyn

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evelyn runs for Jonathan. O'Connell SWINGS his sword and CLEAVES a big chunk of mol flesh rot out of Imhotep's stomach. On the outside, Imhot looks human, but on the inside he is still a rotten old m Imhotep BACKHANDS O'Connell. Knocks him twenty feet back. O'Connell staggers to his feet. Imhotep is right there. C him hard with his left arm. O'Connell spins through the a SLAMS into the side of a mausoleum. Imhotep approaches, r in his eyes. O'Connell gets up, quickly pivots and HACKS  into Imhotep's head. Imhotep grins and PUNCHES O'Connell the face. O'Connell is thrown back, pulling his sword wit him. He bounces hard off the mausoleum. Lands on his feet. Totally beat-to-shit. Knees buckling. He can barely stand Jonathan lifts up the heavy gold book, -- Imhotep's sever hand still clings to it. Jonathan cringes in disgust. Eve yanks it off, throws it away, then start furiously workin the key into the series of locks, unlocking each of them. Imhotep strides forward. O'Connell backs into the mausole swings the sword, Imhotep tries to catch it, -- it CLEAVE through his palm and deeply imbeds itself into his forear No matter, Imhotep rips the sword away from O'Connell and casually flings it away. The golden Book Of The Living opens with a HISS. Jonathan holds it tight as Evelyn quickly turns the heavy gold pag looking for something. O'Connell turns to run, but Imhotep grabs him by the thro and lifts him off his feet. O'Connell hangs there, a daze mess. Imhotep grins, says something in ANCIENT EGYPTIAN,  then starts to strangle O'Connell. O'Connell chokes. Abou to die. Evelyn turns and faces Imhotep and reads an inscription:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kadeesh mal! Kadeesh mal! Pared oos!  PARED OOS!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Imhotep pivots and looks at Evelyn, a look of sheer terro on his face. Then he looks over at the detritus bog. Whic starts to BUBBLE and SHIFT. The SWIRLING HOLE begins to o And then suddenly THE SPIRITS OF THE EGYPTIAN GODS waft o of the black bog and SWIRL around the Priest-mummies. The mummies all collapse and turn to dust. And then the spiri attack Imhotep. Lifting him and O'Connell up into the air Imhotep lets go of O'Connell, who falls to the ground. Evelyn and Jonathan fearfully stumble away from the spiri Jonathan trips and falls and accidentally throws The Book The Living into the detritus bog. Evelyn watches as the g book sinks into the black putrescence. Jonathan looks lik he's about to cry. Ten feet off the ground, the spirits SWIRL around Imhotep body, TWISTING IT and TURNING IT and slowly SHRIVELING IT Accompanied by the same strange FLASHING LIGHT we saw at beginning of the movie when Anck-su-namun was cursed. One last HUGE FLASH, accompanied by a BLAST OF WIND, and Imho is spit out and thrown to the floor. He staggers to his f he looks perfectly normal. His body is completely intact. O'Connell swings his sword. Imhotep jerks back. The sword scrapes Imhotep's chest, -- a swath of blood appears acro Imhotep's chest where the sword hit him. Imhotep touches blood on his chest, amazed and horrified. He's mortal. O'Connell runs Imhotep through with the sword and shoves backwards. Imhotep stumbles back and falls into the detri bog. The sword still in his stomach. Evelyn and Jonathan run up next to O'Connell. They watch Imhotep gently sinks into the fetid swamp, slowly dying. then, just before his head goes under, Imhotep looks up a them, grins broadly, and says something in ANCIENT EGYPTI Evelyn translates:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Death is only the beginning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Imhotep's grinning face vanishes under the black bile.

dialogues.speaker: STAFF CHAMBER
dialogues.text: Beni staggers across a chamber, straining under the weigh of another saddlebag filled with treasure. He spots a lar ornate STAFF sticking out of a wall. He throws the saddle over the staff and collapses against the wall. Exhausted. A BEAT. And then the weight of the treasure PULLS THE STA DOWN. Which starts a massive AURAL CHAIN-REACTION. Beni-backs away from the wall, wide-eyed, filled with fea ALL THE WALLS START TO SINK INTO THE GROUND. Driven by to of pouring sand. Beni turns and hauls ass out of the cham

dialogues.speaker: CEMETERY
dialogues.text: O'Connell, Evelyn and Jonathan look around as all the wal start to DESCEND. O'Connell grabs Evelyn's hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pulls her forward and all three of them race past sink pillars. They duck as they run into a descending doorway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beni scampers down a passageway, the ceiling getting lowe and lower until he has to crouch. And then he has to stic the TORCH between his teeth and crawl on his hands and kn

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Connell, Evelyn and Jonathan crouch-run into the treasu chamber. Evelyn skids to a stop. Looks in wonder at all t treasure. SAND rains down on them. O'Connell grabs her ag and quickly pulls her through the mounds of treasure towa a SINKING DOORWAY on the far side of the room. The SOUND the sinking walls is deafening. Beni crouch-runs into the treasure chamber. O'Connell, Ev and Jonathan race past him. He joins them as they run up staircase. Heading for a DESCENDING DOORWAY, which is alr half gone, it's now only four feet high -- now three feet high -- now two feet. Jonathan dives through the narrow g Then O'Connell dives through, he spins around. Evelyn div but gets stuck in the middle, about to get cut in half. O'Connell grabs her arm and YANKS her through in the nick time. Beni reaches through the narrowing gap with his han

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'CONNELL!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Connell grabs it, but it's too late. Beni yanks his han back just as the top of the door CRASHES to the floor. Sealing him in. Beni quickly crawls back down the stairs the ceiling SLAMS down behind him. He stands up and looks around with his diminishing torch. All the doorways FINISH CLOSING. There's no way out. He's trapped. And then he hears something, and turns around. O in the corner, a scarab-beetle stares at him, CHITTERING. Beni waves his flickering torch at the scarab and backs a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stands in the middle of the treasure chamber as dozens upon dozens of scarabs boil up out of the floor around hi Beni is absolutely terrified. The scarabs start to move i And that's when Beni's torch goes out. PITCH BLACK. A BEA And then we hear Beni start SCREAMING in horror and pain. And the scarabs CHITTERING hungrily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The temple COLLAPSES as O'Connell, Evelyn, Jonathan and a pack of stray camels race through the ruins. A SINKING CR DROPS OUT right behind them. Chasing them out through the front gates. The whole place RUMBLES ominously. They make it down the ramp as more ruins CRASH DOWN behin them. A MASSIVE CLOUD OF SAND AND DUST billows out over t wall and into the air. our heroes and all the stray camel race out into the desert...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Connell, Evelyn and Jonathan stand in the middle of the plateau, surrounded by stray camels. They stare off at th sandy, dusty, volcano as it continues to RUMBLE-ominously

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well,... I guess we go home empty  handed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Connell looks at Evelyn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wouldn't say that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evelyn returns the look, A BEAT, and then she wraps-her a around his neck and kisses him. O'Connell returns it. Jonathan just rolls his eyes, snorts in disgust and climb up onto a camel. When the kiss is over, O'Connell and Evelyn share a smile then O'Connell leaps up into the saddle, reaches down, gr Evelyn's hand and pulls her up behind him. Evelyn wraps h arms around his waist. O'Connell and Jonathan slap the re

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TUK-TUK-TUK!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The camels start to move out. WE PAN DOWN: to the saddleb behind Evelyn, hidden under the closed back flap, -- we c see that it's filled with Beni's stolen TREASURE. O'Connell, Evelyn and Jonathan ride off into the SUNSET.
